original: Dīgha Nikāya 16
analyzed: dīgha nikāya
translated: The Long Discourses of the Buddha

original: Mahāparinibbānasutta
analyzed: mahāparinibbānasutta
translated: The Great Passing

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard:

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha on the Vulture Peak Mountain.

original: Tena kho pana samayena rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vajjī abhiyātukāmo hoti.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena rājā māgadhaḥ ajātasattu vedehiputto vajjī abhiyātu kāmaḥ hoti
translated: At that time King Ajātasattu of Magadha, the son of the Videhi princess, wanted to attack the Vajjians.

original: So evamāha:
analyzed: sā u evam āha
translated: He said:

original: “ahaṁ hime vajjī evaṁmahiddhike evaṁmahānubhāve ucchecchāmi vajjī, vināsessāmi vajjī, anayabyasanaṁ āpādessāmī”ti.
analyzed: aham hime vajjī eva mahiddhike eva mahā anubhāve ucchecchāmi vajjī vināsessāmi vajjī anaya byasanam āpādessāmi iti
translated: “I will destroy the Vajjians, who are so powerful and mighty. I will exterminate them, make them disappear, and annihilate them.”

original: Atha kho rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vassakāraṁ brāhmaṇaṁ magadhamahāmattaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu rājā māgadhaḥ ajātasattu vedehiputtaḥ vassakāram brāhmaṇam magadha mahāmattam āmantesi
translated: Then King Ajātasattu of Magadha, the son of the Videhi princess, addressed the brahmin Vassakāra, chief minister of Magadha:

original: “ehi tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vandāhi, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ puccha:
analyzed: ehi tva brāhmaṇa yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vandāhi appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram puccha
translated: “Please go, brahmin, to the Buddha, and pay homage to him in my name with your head at his feet. Ask if he is free from illness & affliction, is carefree, strong, & living in comfort.

original: ‘rājā, bhante, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchatī’ti.
analyzed: rājā bhante māgadhaḥ ajātasattu vedehiputto bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati iti
translated: ‘Venerable Sir, King Ajatasattu of Magadha, the son of Lady Videhi, bows down at your feet with his head, and asks after your welfare, health, strength, freedom from illness, and comfort.’

original: Evañca vadehi:
analyzed: evañca vadehi
translated: And say this:

original: ‘rājā, bhante, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vajjī abhiyātukāmo.
analyzed: rājā bhante māgadhaḥ ajātasattu vedehiputtaḥ vajjī abhiyātu kāmaḥ
translated: ‘King Ajatasattu of Magadha, the son of Lady Videhi, wants to attack the Vajjians.

original: So evamāha:
analyzed: sā u evam āha
translated: He says:

original: “ahaṁ hime vajjī evaṁmahiddhike evaṁmahānubhāve ucchecchāmi vajjī, vināsessāmi vajjī, anayabyasanaṁ āpādessāmī”’ti.
analyzed: aham hime vajjī eva mahiddhike eva mahā anubhāve ucchecchāmi vajjī vināsessāmi vajjī anaya byasanam āpādessāmi iti
translated: “I will destroy the Vajjians, I will make them perish, I will annihilate them, I will make them vanish, I will make them cease to be!”’

original: Yathā te bhagavā byākaroti, taṁ sādhukaṁ uggahetvā mama āroceyyāsi.
analyzed: yathā te bhagavā byākaroti tam sādhukam uggahetvā mama āroceyyāsi
translated: Remember well what the Buddha says in reply, and tell me.

original: Na hi tathāgatā vitathaṁ bhaṇantī”ti.
analyzed: na hi tathāgatāḥ vitatham bhaṇanti iti
translated: For the Buddhas do not speak falsely.”

original: 1. Vassakārabrāhmaṇa🔽“Evaṁ, bho”ti kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto rañño māgadhassa ajātasattussa
analyzed: vassakārabrāhmaṇa  eva bhoti kho vassakāraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ magadha mahāmattaḥ raññaḥ māgadhassa ajātasattussa
translated: The brahmin Vassakara

original: vedehiputtassa paṭissutvā bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni yojetvā bhaddaṁ bhaddaṁ yānaṁ
analyzed: vedehiputtassa paṭissutvā bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni yojetvā bhaddam bhaddam yāna
translated: ‘Yes, sir,’ replied Vassakara, the brahmin of the Magadhans, and he prepared some fine vehicles. He then took a fine vehicle and drove from Rajagaha as far as the road was passable for vehicles,🔽and then continued on foot to where the Buddha was.

original: abhiruhitvā bhaddehi bhaddehi yānehi rājagahamhā niyyāsi, yena gijjhakūṭo pabbato tena pāyāsi.🔽Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā, yānā paccorohitvā pattikova yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: abhiruhitvā bhaddehi bhaddehi yānehi rājagahamhā niyyāsi yena gijjhakūṭaḥ pabbato tena pāyāsi  yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikā uva yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: and after mounting the fine carriages, he left Rājagaha with the fine carriages, and went to the Vultures’ Peak Mountain.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho vassakāraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ magadha mahāmattaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: After going as far as the ground would allow with the carriages, he descended from the carriages, and approached the Fortunate One by foot, and after approaching and worshipping the Fortunate One, he sat down on one side. While sitting on one side the brāhmaṇa Vassakāra, the chief minister of Magadha, said this to the Fortunate One:

original: “rājā, bho gotama, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto bhoto gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati.
analyzed: rājā bho gotama māgadhaḥ ajātasattu vedehiputto bhotaḥ gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati
translated: “The Magadhan King Ajātasattu, dear Gotama, the son of the (princess) of Videha, worships with his head at the Fortunate One’s feet, and he inquires after your good health, strength, energy, and wellbeing.

original: Rājā, bho gotama, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vajjī abhiyātukāmo.
analyzed: rājā bho gotama māgadhaḥ ajātasattu vedehiputtaḥ vajjī abhiyātu kāmaḥ
translated: The Magadhan King Ajātasattu, dear Gotama, the son of the (princess) of Videha, wishes to attack the Vajjians.

original: So evamāha:
analyzed: sā u evam āha
translated: He says this:

original: ‘ahaṁ hime vajjī evaṁmahiddhike evaṁmahānubhāve ucchecchāmi vajjī, vināsessāmi vajjī, anayabyasanaṁ āpādessāmī’”ti.
analyzed: aham hime vajjī eva mahiddhike eva mahā anubhāve ucchecchāmi vajjī vināsessāmi vajjī anaya byasanam āpādessāmi iti
translated: ‘I will destroy the Vajjis, I will make an end of the Vajjis, I will bring about the destruction and extermination of the Vajjis!’”

original: 2. Rājaaparihāniyadhamma
analyzed: rāja a parihāniya dhamma
translated: The qualities that prevent a king’s decline

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ānando bhagavato piṭṭhito ṭhito hoti bhagavantaṁ bījayamāno.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ piṭṭhitaḥ ṭhitaḥ hoti bhagavantam bījayamāno
translated: At that time Venerable Ānanda was standing behind the Buddha, fanning him.

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: The Buddha said to him,

original: “kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī abhiṇhaṁ sannipātā sannipātabahulā’”ti?
analyzed: kinti te ānanda suta vajjī sannipātā sannipāta bahulā ati
translated: “Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis often gather and meet together?”

original: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī abhiṇhaṁ sannipātā sannipātabahulā’”ti.
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante vajjī abhiṇham sannipātā sannipāta bahulā ati
translated: “Yes, Sir, I have heard that.”

original: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī abhiṇhaṁ sannipātā sannipātabahulā bhavissanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: ānanda vajjī abhiṇham sannipātā sannipāta bahulāḥ bhavissanti vuddhiyā iva ānanda vajjīnam pāṭikaṅkhā no
translated: “As long as the Vajjis often gather and meet together, Ānanda, they can expect growth, not decline.

original: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī samaggā sannipatanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahanti, samaggā vajjikaraṇīyāni karontī’”ti?
analyzed: kinti te ānanda suta vajjī samaggā sannipatanti samaggāḥ vuṭṭhahanti samaggāḥ vajji karaṇīyāni karonti iti
translated: Have you heard that the Vajjis gather and meet together in unity, leave in unity, and carry out Vajji business in unity?”

original: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī samaggā sannipatanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahanti, samaggā vajjikaraṇīyāni karontī’”ti.
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante vajjī samaggā sannipatanti samaggāḥ vuṭṭhahanti samaggāḥ vajji karaṇīyāni karonti iti
translated: ‘Sir, I have heard that the Vajjians gather regularly and meet in harmony; they rise in harmony and carry out their Vajjian duties in harmony.’

original: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī samaggā sannipatissanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahissanti, samaggā vajjikaraṇīyāni karissanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: ānanda vajjī samaggā sannipatissanti samaggāḥ vuṭṭhahissanti samaggāḥ vajji karaṇīyāni karissanti vuddhiyā iva ānanda vajjīnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: ‘As long as the Vajjians gather regularly and meet in harmony; rise in harmony and carry out their Vajjian duties in harmony, they may be expected to prosper and not decline.

original: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī apaññattaṁ na paññapenti, paññattaṁ na samucchindanti, yathāpaññatte porāṇe vajjidhamme samādāya vattantī’”ti?
analyzed: kinti te ānanda suta vajjī a paññattam na paññapenti paññattam na samucchindanti yathā paññatte porāṇe vajji dhamme samādāya vattanti iti
translated: Ānanda, have you heard why the Vajjians are prosperous and powerful?’

original: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī apaññattaṁ na paññapenti, paññattaṁ na samucchindanti, yathāpaññatte porāṇe vajjidhamme samādāya vattantī’”ti.
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante vajjī a paññattam na paññapenti paññattam na samucchindanti yathā paññatte porāṇe vajji dhamme samādāya vattanti iti
translated: ‘Sir, I have heard that the Vajjians do not authorise what has not been authorised already, and do not abolish what has been authorised, but proceed according to what has been authorised by their ancient tradition.’

original: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī apaññattaṁ na paññapessanti, paññattaṁ na samucchindissanti,
analyzed: yāvakīvañcaḥ ānanda vajjī a paññattam na paññapessanti paññattam na samucchindissanti
translated: ‘As long as the Vajjians do not authorise what has not been authorised already, and do not abolish what has been authorised, but proceed according to what has been authorised by their ancient tradition,

original: yathāpaññatte porāṇe vajjidhamme samādāya vattissanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ
analyzed: yathā paññatte porāṇe vajji dhamme samādāya vattissanti ānanda
translated: and they continue to observe the ancient traditions of the Vajjīs as they have been observed before,

original: pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: pāṭikaṅkhā no
translated: then growth, not decline, can be expected for the Vajjīs.

original: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī ye te vajjīnaṁ vajjimahallakā, te sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tesañca sotabbaṁ maññantī’”ti?
analyzed: kinti te ānanda suta vajjī ye te vajjīnam vajji mahallakā te sakkaronti garum karonti mānenti pūjenti tesam ca sotabbam maññanti iti
translated: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjīs honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjī elders and consider them worth listening to?”

original: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī ye te vajjīnaṁ vajjimahallakā, te sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tesañca sotabbaṁ maññantī’”ti.🔽“Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī ye te vajjīnaṁ vajjimahallakā, te sakkarissanti garuṁ
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante vajjī ye te vajjīnam vajji mahallakā te sakkaronti garum karonti mānenti pūjenti tesam ca sotabbam maññanti iti  ānanda vajjī ye te vajjīnam vajji mahallakā te sakkarissanti garu
translated: “Venerable Sir, I have heard that the Vajjīs honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjī elders and consider them worth listening to.”

original: karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti, tesañca sotabbaṁ maññissanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda,
analyzed: karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti tesam ca sotabbam maññissanti vuddhiyā iva ānanda
translated: “As long as the Vajjīs honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjī elders and consider them worth listening to,

original: vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: vajjīnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: growth, not decline, can be expected for the Vajjīs.

original: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī yā tā kulitthiyo kulakumāriyo, tā na okkassa pasayha vāsentī’”ti?
analyzed: kinti te ānanda suta vajjī yā tā kulitthiyaḥ kula kumāriyaḥ tā naḥ okkassa pasayha vāsenti iti
translated: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjīs do not authorize what has not been authorized already, and do not abolish what has been authorized, but proceed according to what has been authorized by the Vajjī elders?

original: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī yā tā kulitthiyo kulakumāriyo tā na okkassa pasayha vāsentī’”ti.
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante vajjī yā tā kulitthiyaḥ kula kumāriyaḥ tā naḥ okkassa pasayha vāsenti iti
translated: “I have heard that the Vajjians do not forcibly abduct others’ wives and daughters and hold them down by force.”

original: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī yā tā kulitthiyo kulakumāriyo, tā na okkassa pasayha vāsessanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: ānanda vajjī yā tā kulitthiyaḥ kula kumāriyaḥ tāḥ naḥ okkassa pasayha vāsessanti ānanda vajjīnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: “As long as the Vajjians do not forcibly abduct others’ wives and daughters and hold them down by force, they may be expected to prosper and not decline.

original: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnaṁ vajjicetiyāni abbhantarāni ceva🔽bāhirāni ca, tāni sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tesañca dinnapubbaṁ katapubbaṁ
analyzed: kinti te ānanda suta vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnam vajji cetiyāni abbhantarāni ca iva  bāhirāni ca tāni sakkaronti garum karonti mānenti pūjenti tesam ca dinna pubbam kata pubba
translated: Have you heard, Ānanda, whether the Vajjians honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines at home and abroad,

original: dhammikaṁ baliṁ no parihāpentī’”ti?
analyzed: dhammikam balim no parihāpenti iti
translated: and do not allow the righteous offerings made to them in the past to be diminished?”

original: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnaṁ vajjicetiyāni abbhantarāni ceva bāhirāni🔽ca, tāni sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjenti tesañca dinnapubbaṁ katapubbaṁ
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnam vajji cetiyāni abbhantarāni ca iva bāhirāni  ca tāni sakkaronti garum karonti mānenti pūjenti tesam ca dinna pubbam kata pubba
translated: “I have heard that the Vajjians honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines at home and abroad,

original: dhammikaṁ baliṁ no parihāpentī’”ti.
analyzed: dhammikam balim no parihāpenti iti
translated: and do not allow the righteous offerings made to them in the past to be diminished.”

original: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnaṁ vajjicetiyāni abbhantarāni ceva bāhirāni🔽ca, tāni sakkarissanti garuṁ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti, tesañca dinnapubbaṁ
analyzed: ānanda vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnam vajji cetiyāni abbhantarāni ca iva bāhirāni  ca tāni sakkarissanti garum karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti tesam ca dinna pubba
translated: “As long as the Vajjians honour, respect, venerate, and do homage to the Vajjian shrines here and now, regarding them as sacred and not superseding the ordinances relating to them,

original: katapubbaṁ dhammikaṁ baliṁ no parihāpessanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: kata pubbam dhammikam balim no parihāpessanti vuddhiyā iva ānanda vajjīnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: “As long as the Vajjians honour, respect, venerate, and do homage to the Vajjian shrines at home and abroad, regarding them as worthy of offerings and respect, and do not let the proper offerings and services to them decline, the Vajjians can expect growth, not decline.

original: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjīnaṁ arahantesu dhammikā rakkhāvaraṇagutti susaṁvihitā, kinti anāgatā ca arahanto vijitaṁ āgaccheyyuṁ, āgatā ca arahanto vijite phāsu vihareyyun’”ti?
analyzed: kinti te ānanda suta arahantesu dhammikā rakkhā āvaraṇa gutti su sa vihitā kinti anāgatā ca arahantaḥ vijitam āgaccheyyu āgatā ca arahantaḥ vijite phāsu vihareyyunti
translated: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjians do not authorize what has not been authorized already and do not abolish what has been authorized, but proceed according to what has been authorized by their ancient tradition?”

original: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante ‘vajjīnaṁ arahantesu dhammikā rakkhāvaraṇagutti susaṁvihitā kinti anāgatā ca arahanto vijitaṁ āgaccheyyuṁ, āgatā ca arahanto vijite phāsu vihareyyun’”ti.
analyzed: sutam mā ita bhante arahantesu dhammikā rakkhā āvaraṇa gutti su sa vihitā kinti anāgatā ca arahantaḥ vijitam āgaccheyyu āgatā ca arahantaḥ vijite phāsu vihareyyunti
translated: “I have heard that they do not do these things.”

original: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ arahantesu dhammikā rakkhāvaraṇagutti susaṁvihitā
analyzed: ānanda arahantesu dhammikā rakkhā āvaraṇa gutti su sa vihitā
translated: “As long as the Vajjīs respectfully support the arahants,🔽and those arahants who have not yet arrived in the Vajjī country will come,

original: bhavissati, kinti anāgatā ca arahanto vijitaṁ āgaccheyyuṁ, āgatā ca arahanto vijite
analyzed: bhavissati kinti anāgatā ca arahantaḥ vijitam āgaccheyyu āgatā ca arahantaḥ vijite
translated: and those arahants who have already arrived will stay in comfort,

original: phāsu vihareyyunti. Vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
analyzed: phāsu vihareyyunti ānanda vajjīnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni iti
translated: the Vajjīs can expect growth, not decline.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā vassakāraṁ brāhmaṇaṁ magadhamahāmattaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā vassakāram brāhmaṇam magadha mahāmattam āmantesi
translated: Then the Buddha said to the brahmin Vassakāra, the chief minister of Magadha:

original: “ekamidāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, samayaṁ vesāliyaṁ viharāmi sārandade cetiye.🔽Tatrāhaṁ vajjīnaṁ ime satta aparihāniye dhamme desesiṁ.
analyzed: ekam id āha brāhmaṇa samayam vesāliyam viharāmi sārandade cetiye  tatra aham vajjīnam ime satta aparihāniye dhamme desesi
translated: “Once, while staying at Vesālī,🔽I taught the Vajjīs seven principles that lead to growth and prosperity.

original: Yāvakīvañca, brāhmaṇa, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā vajjīsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu
analyzed: brāhmaṇa ime satta aparihāniyāḥ dhammāḥ vajjīsu imesu ca sattasu
translated: As long as these principles endure among them,🔽and as long as the Vajjīs are seen following them,

original: aparihāniyesu dhammesu vajjī sandississanti, vuddhiyeva, brāhmaṇa, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
analyzed: a parihāniyesu dhammesu vajjī sandississanti vuddhiyā iva brāhmaṇa vajjīnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni iti
translated: the Vajjīs can expect growth, not decline.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte vassakāraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ magadha mahāmattaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Vassakāra said to the Buddha,

original: “ekamekenapi, bho gotama, aparihāniyena dhammena samannāgatānaṁ vajjīnaṁ vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: ekam ekena api bho gotama a parihāniyena dhammena samannāgatānam vajjīnam vuddhiyā iva pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: “If the Vajjians possess even one of these qualities that prevent decline, they can expect growth, not decline.

original: Ko pana vādo sattahi aparihāniyehi dhammehi.
analyzed: kaḥ pana vādaḥ sattahi a parihāniyehi dhammehi
translated: What to speak of seven?

original: Akaraṇīyāva, bho gotama, vajjī raññā māgadhena ajātasattunā vedehiputtena yadidaṁ yuddhassa, aññatra upalāpanāya aññatra mithubhedā.
analyzed: a karaṇīyā ava bho gotama vajjī raññā māgadhena ajātasattunā vedehiputtena yat idam yuddhassa aññatra upalāpanāya aññatra mithu bhedā
translated: The Vajjians cannot be conquered by King Ajātasattu of Magadha, except through treachery or internal dissension.

original: Handa ca dāni mayaṁ, bho gotama, gacchāma, bahukiccā mayaṁ bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: handa ca dāni maya bho gotama gacchāma bahu kiccā mayam bahu karaṇīyā ati
translated: Now, sir, we must go. We have many duties, and there is much that needs to be done.”

original: “Yassadāni tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, kālaṁ maññasī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni tva brāhmaṇa kālam maññasi iti
translated: “Brahmin, you may go at your own convenience.”

original: Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho vassakāraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ magadha mahāmattaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: After rejoicing in and approving of the Buddha’s words, Vassakāra got up from his seat and left.

original: 3. Bhikkhuaparihāniyadhamma
analyzed: bhikkhu a parihāniya dhamma
translated: The qualities that prevent decline for monks

original: Atha kho bhagavā acirapakkante vassakāre brāhmaṇe magadhamahāmatte āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā acira pakkante vassakāre brāhmaṇe magadha mahāmatte āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: Soon after Vassakāra had left, the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda:

original: “gaccha tvaṁ, ānanda, yāvatikā bhikkhū rājagahaṁ upanissāya viharanti, te sabbe upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ sannipātehī”ti.🔽“Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā yāvatikā bhikkhū rājagahaṁ
analyzed: gaccha tvaṃ ānanda yāvatikāḥ bhikkhū rājagaham upanissāya viharanti te sabbe upaṭṭhāna sālāyam sannipātehi iti  eva bhante iti kho āyasman ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paṭissutvā yāvatikāḥ bhikkhū rājagaha
translated: “Go, Ānanda, and assemble in the attendance hall all the monks who live in dependence on Rājagaha.”

original: upanissāya viharanti, te sabbe upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ sannipātetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami;
analyzed: upanissāya viharanti te sabbe upaṭṭhāna sālāyam sannipātetvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami
translated: Responding, “As you say, lord,” to the Blessed One, Ānanda assembled in the attendance hall all the monks who lived in dependence on Rājagaha.

original: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho āyasmā
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho āyasmā
translated: Then he went to the Blessed One and, on arrival, having bowed down to him, stood to one side.

original: ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: As he was standing there, he said to the Blessed One,🔽“Lord, the Saṅgha of monks has assembled.

original: “sannipatito, bhante, bhikkhusaṅgho, yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṁ maññatī”ti.🔽Atha kho bhagavā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena upaṭṭhānasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: sannipatitaḥ bhante bhikkhu saṅghaḥ yassadāni bhante bhagavā kālam maññati iti  atha kho bhagavā uṭṭhāya āsanā yena upaṭṭhāna sālā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: May the Blessed One do what he thinks it is now time to do.”

original: Nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Then the Blessed One got up from his seat and went to the attendance hall. On arrival, he sat down on a seat laid out, and said to the monks,

original: “satta vo, bhikkhave, aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi,
analyzed: satta vaḥ bhikkhave aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi
translated: “Monks, I will teach you seven things that prevent decline.

original: taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasikarotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇātha sādhukam manasikarotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato
translated: “Yes, lord,” the monks replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū abhiṇhaṁ sannipātā sannipātabahulā bhavissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū abhiṇham sannipātā sannipāta bahulāḥ bhavissanti vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: “Monks, as long as the monks gather frequently and often, they can expect growth, not decline.

original: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū samaggā sannipatissanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahissanti, samaggā saṅghakaraṇīyāni karissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū samaggā sannipatissanti samaggāḥ vuṭṭhahissanti samaggāḥ saṅgha karaṇīyāni karissanti vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: As long as the monks gather together in unity, leave in unity, and do their transactions in unity, they can expect growth, not decline.

original: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū apaññattaṁ na paññapessanti, paññattaṁ na samucchindissanti,🔽yathāpaññattesu sikkhāpadesu samādāya vattissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū a paññattam na paññapessanti paññattam na samucchindissanti  yathā paññattesu sikkhāpadesu samādāya vattissanti bhikkhave bhikkhūna
translated: As long as the monks don’t institute what hasn’t been instituted and don’t abolish what has been instituted,

original: pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: pāṭikaṅkhā no
translated: but practice following the precepts as they have been instituted, they can expect growth, not decline.

original: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro
analyzed: bhikkhave bhikkhū ye te bhikkhū therāḥ rattaññū cira pabbajitāḥ saṅgha pitaro
translated: As long as the monks honor, respect, and provide for the senior monks—those elder monks who have been monks for a long time and are fathers and leaders of the Sangha—

original: saṅghapariṇāyakā, te sakkarissanti garuṁ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti, tesañca
analyzed: saṅgha pariṇāyakā te sakkarissanti garum karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti tesam ca
translated: As long as the monks will honor, respect, venerate, and do homage to the senior monks, the long-standing fathers of the Saṅgha who have long since gone forth,

original: sotabbaṁ maññissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.🔽Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū uppannāya taṇhāya ponobbhavikāya na vasaṁ gacchissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.🔽Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū āraññakesu senāsanesu sāpekkhā bhavissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: sotabbam maññissanti vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni  yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū uppannāya taṇhāya ponobbhavikāya na vasam gacchissanti vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni  yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū āraññakesu senāsanesu sa apekkhāḥ bhavissanti vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: and will think it worthwhile to listen to them, the monks can expect growth, not decline.🔽As long as the monks will not come under the control of craving that arises newly, the monks can expect growth, not decline.🔽As long as the monks will be intent on wilderness dwellings, the monks can expect growth, not decline.

original: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū paccattaññeva satiṁ upaṭṭhapessanti: ‘kinti anāgatā
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū paccattaññā iva satim upaṭṭhapessanti kinti anāgatā
translated: As long as the monks will establish mindfulness, thinking, ‘This is unbeneficial,’ ‘This is blameworthy,’ ‘This is criticized by the wise,’ ‘This, when undertaken and performed, will lead to harm and suffering,’ the monks can expect growth, not decline.

original: ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṁ, āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsu vihareyyun’ti.
analyzed: ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyu āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsu vihareyyunti
translated: and that good people, companions in the holy life, would come to live with me, and that when they come they would be comfortable living with me.’

original: Vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.🔽Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca
analyzed: vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni  bhikkhave ime satta aparihāniyāḥ dhammāḥ bhikkhūsu imesu ca
translated: Monks, you can expect growth, not decline.🔽For as long as these seven conditions that prevent decline last among monks,

original: sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ
analyzed: sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūna
translated: and for as long as monks are seen conducting themselves by these seven conditions that prevent decline,

original: pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: pāṭikaṅkhā no
translated: you can expect growth, not decline.

original: Aparepi vo, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi, taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasikarotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: apare pi vaḥ bhikkhave satta a parihāniye dhamme desessāmi tam suṇātha sādhukam manasikarotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: I will teach you seven more conditions that prevent decline. Listen and pay careful attention, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato
translated: “Yes, Bhante,” they replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na kammārāmā bhavissanti na kammaratā na kammārāmatamanuyuttā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū na kamma ārāmāḥ bhavissanti na kamma ratāḥ na kamma ārāma tam anuyuttāḥ vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: “For as long, monks, as the monks are not devoted to making merit, do not enjoy making merit, and are not intent on making merit,

original: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na bhassārāmā bhavissanti na bhassaratā na bhassārāmatamanuyuttā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.🔽Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na niddārāmā bhavissanti na niddāratā na niddārāmatamanuyuttā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.🔽Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na saṅgaṇikārāmā bhavissanti na saṅgaṇikaratā na saṅgaṇikārāmatamanuyuttā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū na bhassa ārāmāḥ bhavissanti na bhassa ratāḥ na bhassa ārāma tam anuyuttāḥ vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni  yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū na niddā rāmāḥ bhavissanti na niddā ratāḥ na niddā rāma tam anuyuttāḥ vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni  yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū na saṅgaṇika ārāmāḥ bhavissanti na saṅgaṇika ratāḥ na saṅgaṇikā ārāma tam anuyuttāḥ vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: As long as the monks are not devoted to proliferation, delighting in proliferation, committed to delight in proliferation, growth can be expected for them, not decline.🔽As long as the monks are not devoted to sleep, delighting in sleep, committed to delight in sleep, growth can be expected for them, not decline.🔽As long as the monks are not devoted to company, delighting in company, committed to delight in company, growth can be expected for them, not decline.

original: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na pāpicchā bhavissanti na pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gatā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū na pāpa icchāḥ bhavissanti na pāpikānam icchānam vasam gatā vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: As long as the monks are not of evil desires, overpowered by evil desires, growth can be expected for them, not decline.

original: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na pāpamittā bhavissanti na pāpasahāyā na pāpasampavaṅkā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū na pāpa mittāḥ bhavissanti na pāpa sahāyāḥ na pāpa sampavaṅkāḥ vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni
translated: As long as the monks don’t have bad friends, bad companions, bad comrades, expect growth, not decline.

original: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na oramattakena visesādhigamena antarāvosānaṁ āpajjissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.🔽Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca🔽sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū na oramattakena visesa adhigamena antara avosānam āpajjissanti vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni  bhikkhave ime satta aparihāniyāḥ dhammāḥ bhikkhūsu imesu ca  sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūna
translated: As long as the monks don’t fall into negligence after attaining distinction, expect growth, not decline.

original: pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: pāṭikaṅkhā no
translated: As long as these seven things that prevent decline last among the monks, and as long as the monks are seen following them, expect growth, not decline.

original: Aparepi vo, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi …pe….
analyzed: apare pi vaḥ bhikkhave satta aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi pe
translated: I will teach you seven more things that prevent decline. …

original: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū saddhā bhavissanti …pe…🔽hirimanā bhavissanti …
analyzed: yāvakīvat ca bhikkhave bhikkhū saddhāḥ bhavissanti pe  hirimanāḥ bhavissanti
translated: As long as the monks have faith …🔽a sense of shame …

original: ottappī bhavissanti …
analyzed: ottappī bhavissanti
translated: restraint …

original: bahussutā bhavissanti …
analyzed: bahu sutāḥ bhavissanti
translated: great learning …

original: āraddhavīriyā bhavissanti …
analyzed: āraddha vīriyāḥ bhavissanti
translated: they will be energetic …

original: upaṭṭhitassatī bhavissanti …
analyzed: upaṭṭhitassatī bhavissanti
translated: they will be mindful …

original: paññavanto bhavissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.🔽Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca
analyzed: paññavantaḥ bhavissanti vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūnam pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni  bhikkhave ime satta aparihāniyāḥ dhammāḥ bhikkhūsu imesu ca
translated: they will be wise, the number of monks can only increase, not decrease.🔽As long as these seven things that prevent decline last among monks

original: sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ
analyzed: sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti vuddhiyā iva bhikkhave bhikkhūna
translated: and are seen in them, the number of monks

original: pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
analyzed: pāṭikaṅkhā no
translated: can only increase, not decrease.

original: Aparepi vo, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi, taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasikarotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: apare pi vaḥ bhikkhave satta a parihāniye dhamme desessāmi tam suṇātha sādhukam manasikarotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: I will teach you seven more things that prevent decline. Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato
translated: “Yes, Venerable Sir,” they replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …pe…🔽dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …🔽vīriyasambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …
analyzed: yāvakīvant ca bhikkhave bhikkhu sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāvessanti pe  dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgam bhāvessanti  vīriya sambojjhaṅgam bhāvessanti
translated: “As long as monks develop the enlightenment factor of mindfulness …🔽the enlightenment factor of discrimination of phenomena …🔽the enlightenment factor of energy …

original: pītisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …
analyzed: pīti sambojjhaṅgam bhāvessanti
translated: the enlightenment factor of rapture …

original: passaddhisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …
analyzed: passaddhi sambojjhaṅgam bhāvessanti
translated: the factor of complete awakening that is concentration …

original: samādhisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …
analyzed: samādhi sambojjhaṅgam bhāvessanti
translated: the factor of complete awakening that is equanimity …

analyzed: atha kiñcarahi te sāriputta uḷārā āsabhī vācā bhāsitā ekasaḥ gahitaḥ sīha nādaḥ naditaḥ
translated: So why have you spoken this inspired utterance, uttered this lion’s roar:🔽‘Venerable Sir, I have such confidence in the Buddha

original: ‘evaṁpasanno ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavati; na cāhu na ca bhavissati na cetarahi vijjati añño samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā bhagavatā bhiyyobhiññataro yadidaṁ sambodhiyan’”ti?
analyzed: eva pasannaḥ aha bhante bhagavati na ca āhu na ca bhavissati na ca itarahi vijjati aññaḥ samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā bhagavatā bhiyyobhiññataraḥ yat idam sambodhiyanti
translated: that I don’t think there exists, either in the past or present, another ascetic or brahmin who is more spiritually accomplished than the Buddha, that is, in terms of awakening’?”

original: “Na kho me, bhante, atītānāgatapaccuppannesu arahantesu sammāsambuddhesu cetopariyañāṇaṁ atthi,
analyzed: na kho me bhante atīta anāgata paccuppannesu arahantesu sammāsambuddhesu cetaḥ pariya ñāṇam atthi
translated: “Sir, I don’t have the knowledge to know the minds of the Realized Ones of the past, future, and present.

original: api ca me dhammanvayo vidito.
analyzed: api ca me dhamma anvayaḥ viditaḥ
translated: But I know the principle.

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante, rañño paccantimaṁ nagaraṁ daḷhuddhāpaṁ daḷhapākāratoraṇaṁ ekadvāraṁ,
analyzed: seyyathā api bhante raññaḥ paccantimam nagaram daḷhuddhāpam daḷha pākāra toraṇam eka dvāra
translated: Suppose there were a fortified city, and outside the city in the east there was a great tree.

original: tatrassa dovāriko paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī aññātānaṁ nivāretā ñātānaṁ pavesetā.
analyzed: tatra assa dovārikaḥ paṇḍitaḥ viyattaḥ medhāvī aññātānam nivāretā ñātānam pavesetā
translated: And a wise man with good sight were to stand on the top of the city wall and say:🔽‘I don’t know the minds of those people inside the city,

original: So tassa nagarassa samantā anupariyāyapathaṁ anukkamamāno na passeyya pākārasandhiṁ vā pākāravivaraṁ vā, antamaso biḷāranikkhamanamattampi.
analyzed: saḥ tassa nagarassa samantā anupariyāya patham anukkamamānaḥ na passeyya pākāra sandhim vā pākāra vivaram vā antamasaḥ biḷāra nikkhamana mattam pi
translated: As he was going around and through the town on inspection, he would not see a gap in the ramparts even big enough for a cat to slip through.

original: Tassa evamassa:
analyzed: tassa evamassa
translated: He would think:

original: ‘ye kho keci oḷārikā pāṇā imaṁ nagaraṁ pavisanti vā nikkhamanti vā, sabbe te imināva dvārena pavisanti vā nikkhamanti vā’ti.
analyzed: ye kho keci oḷārikā pāṇāḥ imam nagaram pavisanti vā nikkhamanti vā sabbe te iminā ava dvārena pavisanti vā nikkhamanti vā ati
translated: ‘Whatever large creatures enter or leave the town, all of them do so by this gate.’

original: Evameva kho me, bhante, dhammanvayo vidito:
analyzed: evam eva kho me bhante dhammanvayaḥ viditaḥ
translated: In the same way, venerable sir, I have understood the sequence of the Dhamma🔽that those who in the past were Arahants, Fully Enlightened Ones,

original: ‘ye te, bhante, ahesuṁ atītamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, sabbe te bhagavanto
analyzed: ye te bhante ahesum atītam addhānam arahanto sammāsambuddhā sabbe te bhagavanto
translated: all those Blessed Ones🔽having abandoned the five hindrances, those defilements of awareness that weaken wisdom,

original: pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu
analyzed: pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetasaḥ upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu
translated: and established their minds in the four establishments of mindfulness,🔽developed the seven factors of enlightenment as they really are,

original: supatiṭṭhitacittā sattabojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṁ bhāvetvā anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambujjhiṁsu.
analyzed: su patiṭṭhita cittā satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtam bhāvetvā anuttaram sammāsambodhim
translated: and fully awakened to the supreme perfect enlightenment.🔽Those who in the future will be Arahants, Fully Enlightened Ones,

original: Yepi te, bhante, bhavissanti anāgatamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, sabbe te bhagavanto
analyzed: ye pi te bhante bhavissanti anāgatam addhānam arahanto sammāsambuddhā sabbe te bhagavanto
translated: all those Blessed Ones …

original: pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu
analyzed: pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetasaḥ upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu
translated: having given up the five hindrances, having cut through the five lower fetters, having established the four establishments of mindfulness well,

original: supatiṭṭhitacittā satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṁ bhāvetvā anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambujjhissanti.
analyzed: su patiṭṭhita cittā satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtam bhāvetvā anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambujjhissanti
translated: having developed the seven factors of awakening as they really are, will fully awaken to the unsurpassed and perfect Awakening.

original: Bhagavāpi, bhante, etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese
analyzed: bhagavā api bhante etarahi araham sammāsambuddhaḥ pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetasaḥ upakkilese
translated: And the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha, having given up the five hindrances, having cut through the five lower fetters,

original: paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu supatiṭṭhitacitto satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṁ
analyzed: paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu su patiṭṭhita citto satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūta
translated: having established the four establishments of mindfulness well, having developed the seven factors of awakening as they really are,

original: bhāvetvā anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’”ti.
analyzed: bhāvetvā anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ iti
translated: has fully awakened to the unsurpassed and perfect Awakening.”

original: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā nāḷandāyaṁ viharanto pāvārikambavane etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
analyzed: tatra api sudam bhagavā nāḷandāyam viharantaḥ pāvārikambavane etat eva bahulam bhikkhūnam dhammim katham karoti
translated: And while the Fortunate One was dwelling near Nāḷandā in Pāvārika’s Mango Wood he often gave this Dhamma talk to the monks:

original: “iti sīlaṁ, iti samādhi, iti paññā.🔽Sīlaparibhāvito samādhi mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṁso.
analyzed: iti sīla iti samādhi iti paññā  sīla paribhāvito samādhi mahapphalaḥ hoti mahā nisaso
translated: “Thus is virtue, thus is concentration, thus is wisdom.🔽Concentration, when developed and made much of, brings great fruit and brings great advantages.

original: Samādhiparibhāvitā paññā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā.
analyzed: samādhi paribhāvitā paññā mahapphalā hoti mahā nisasā
translated: Wisdom, when developed and made much of, brings great fruit and brings great advantages.

original: Paññāparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ sammadeva āsavehi vimuccati, seyyathidaṁ—🔽kāmāsavā, bhavāsavā, avijjāsavā”ti.
analyzed: paññā paribhāvitam cittam sammat eva āsavehi vimuccati  kāma āsavā bhava āsavā avijja āsavā ati
translated: When the mind is developed with wisdom, it is completely liberated from the corruptions, that is,

original: 5. Dussīlaādīnava
analyzed: dussīla ādīnava
translated: from the corruption of sensual desire, the corruption of being, and the corruption of ignorance.”🔽The drawbacks of being immoral, etc.

original: Atha kho bhagavā nāḷandāyaṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān nāḷandāyam yathābhirantam viharitvā āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: When the Buddha had stayed at Nāḷandā for as long as he liked, he said to Venerable Ānanda,

original: “āyāmānanda, yena pāṭaligāmo tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
analyzed: āyāma ānanda yena pāṭali gāmaḥ tena upasaṅkamissāma ati
translated: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Pāṭali Village.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, Sir,” Ānanda replied.

original: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena pāṭaligāmo tadavasari.🔽Assosuṁ kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā: “bhagavā kira pāṭaligāmaṁ anuppatto”ti.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim yena pāṭaligāmaḥ tat avasari  assosum kho pāṭaligāmikāḥ upāsakāḥ bhagavā kira pāṭaligāmam anuppatto ti
translated: The Buddha then went with a large sangha of monks to Pāṭali Village.🔽The lay followers of Pāṭali Village heard that the Buddha had arrived.🔽They went to the Buddha,🔽bowed, sat down,

original: Atha kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ🔽abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: atha khalu pāṭaligāmikāḥ upāsakāḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavanta  abhivādetvā ekamantam ekamantam nisīdisu ekamantam nisinnāḥ kho pāṭaligāmikāḥ upāsakāḥ bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: and said,

original: “adhivāsetu no, bhante, bhagavā āvasathāgāran”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu naḥ bhante bhagavā
translated: “Sir, please accept a dwelling for the rainy season right here in Pāṭali Village.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.🔽Atha kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena  atha khalu pāṭaligāmikāḥ upāsakāḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavanta
translated: The Blessed One consented by remaining silent.

original: abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā yena āvasathāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā yena āvasatha āgāram tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā
translated: Then the lay followers of Pāṭaligāma, understanding that the Blessed One had consented, got up from their seats, bowed down to him, circumambulated him, keeping him to their right, and went to the rest-house.

original: sabbasanthariṁ āvasathāgāraṁ santharitvā āsanāni paññapetvā udakamaṇikaṁ patiṭṭhāpetvā
analyzed: sabba santharim āvasatha āgāram santharitvā āsanāni paññapetvā udaka maṇikam patiṭṭhāpetvā
translated: On arrival, they spread it all over with felt rugs, arranged seats, set out a water vessel, and raised an oil lamp.

original: telapadīpaṁ āropetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā🔽ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: telapadīpam āropetvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamiṣu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā  ekamantam aṭṭhasu ekamantam ṭhitā kho pāṭaligāmikāḥ upāsakāḥ bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: Then they went to the Blessed One and, on arrival, having bowed down to him, stood to one side.

original: “sabbasantharisanthataṁ, bhante, āvasathāgāraṁ, āsanāni paññattāni, udakamaṇiko patiṭṭhāpito, telapadīpo āropito;
analyzed: bhante āvasatha āgāre āsanāni paññattāni udaka maṇikaḥ patiṭṭhāpito tela padīpaḥ āropito
translated: As they were standing there they said to him, “Lord, the rest-house has been covered all over with felt rugs, seats have been arranged, a water vessel has been set out, and an oil lamp raised.

original: yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṁ maññatī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni bhante bhagavā kālam maññati iti
translated: May the Blessed One do what you think it is now time to do.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sāyanha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: In the evening, the Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to the new dwelling together with the Sangha of monks.

original: yena āvasathāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā pāde pakkhāletvā āvasathāgāraṁ pavisitvā
analyzed: yena āvasathāgāram tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā pāde pakkhāletvā āvasathāgāram pavisitvā
translated: He washed his feet, entered the dwelling,

original: majjhimaṁ thambhaṁ nissāya puratthābhimukho nisīdi.🔽Bhikkhusaṅghopi kho pāde pakkhāletvā āvasathāgāraṁ pavisitvā pacchimaṁ bhittiṁ nissāya puratthābhimukho nisīdi bhagavantameva purakkhatvā.
analyzed: majjhimam thambham nissāya purattha abhimukhaḥ nisīdi  bhikkhu saṅghaḥ api kho pāde pakkhāletvā āvasatha āgāram pavisitvā pacchimam bhittim nissāya purattha abhimukhaḥ nisīdi bhagavantam eva purakkhatvā
translated: and sat down against the central column facing east.🔽The Sangha of monks washed their feet, entered the dwelling, and sat down against the western wall facing east, with the Buddha in front of them.

original: Pāṭaligāmikāpi kho upāsakā pāde pakkhāletvā āvasathāgāraṁ pavisitvā puratthimaṁ bhittiṁ nissāya pacchimābhimukhā nisīdiṁsu bhagavantameva purakkhatvā.
analyzed: pāṭaligāmikā api kho upāsakā pāde pakkhāletvā āvasathāgāram pavisitvā puratthimam bhittim nissāya pacchima abhimukhāḥ nisīdisu bhagavantam eva purakkhatvā
translated: The lay followers of Pāṭaligāma washed their feet, entered the dwelling, and sat down against the eastern wall facing west, with the Buddha in front of them.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pāṭaligāmike upāsake āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā pāṭaligāmike upāsake āmantesi
translated: The Buddha said to them,

original: “pañcime, gahapatayo, ādīnavā dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
analyzed: pañcime gahapatayaḥ ādīnavāḥ dussīlassa sīla vipattiyā
translated: “Householders, there are these five dangers for one who is unvirtuous because of failure in morality.

original: Katame pañca?
analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What are the five?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno pamādādhikaraṇaṁ mahatiṁ bhogajāniṁ nigacchati.
analyzed: idha gahapatayaḥ dussīlaḥ sīla vipannaḥ pamāda adhikaraṇam mahatim bhoga jānim nigacchati
translated: Here, householders, an unvirtuous person, one deficient in virtue, on account of carelessness comes to great loss of wealth.

original: Ayaṁ paṭhamo ādīnavo dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
analyzed: ayam paṭhamaḥ ādīnavaḥ dussīlassa sīla vipattiyā
translated: This is the first danger for an unvirtuous person, one deficient in virtue.

original: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, dussīlassa sīlavipannassa pāpako kittisaddo abbhuggacchati.
analyzed: puna capara gahapatayaḥ dussīlassa sīla vipannassa pāpakaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggacchati
translated: “And further, the bad reputation of an unvirtuous person, one deficient in virtue, gets spread about.

original: Ayaṁ dutiyo ādīnavo dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
analyzed: ayam dutiyaḥ ādīnavaḥ dussīlassa sīla vipattiyā
translated: This is the second danger for an unvirtuous person, one deficient in virtue.

original: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno yaññadeva parisaṁ upasaṅkamati—yadi
analyzed: puna capara gahapatayaḥ dussīlaḥ sīla vipannaḥ yaññat eva parisam upasaṅkamati yadi
translated: “And further, an unvirtuous person, one deficient in virtue, whatever assembly he approaches—

original: khattiyaparisaṁ yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṁ yadi gahapatiparisaṁ yadi samaṇaparisaṁ—avisārado
analyzed: khattiya parisam yadi brāhmaṇa parisam yadi gahapati parisam yadi samaṇa parisa a visāra daḥ
translated: whether an assembly of nobles, a brahman assembly, an assembly of householders, or an assembly of contemplatives—

original: upasaṅkamati maṅkubhūto.
analyzed: upasaṅkamati maṅku bhūtaḥ
translated: he does not approach it with confidence.

original: Ayaṁ tatiyo ādīnavo dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
analyzed: ayam tatiyaḥ ādīnavaḥ dussīlassa sīla vipattiyā
translated: This is the third danger for an unvirtuous person, one deficient in virtue.

original: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno sammūḷho kālaṁ karoti.
analyzed: puna capara gahapatayaḥ dussīlaḥ sīla vipannaḥ sammūḍhaḥ kālam karoti
translated: “And further, an unvirtuous person, one deficient in virtue, dies confused.

original: Ayaṁ catuttho ādīnavo dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
analyzed: ayam catutthaḥ ādīnavaḥ dussīlassa sīla vipattiyā
translated: This is the fourth danger for an unvirtuous person, one deficient in virtue.

original: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.🔽Ayaṁ pañcamo ādīnavo dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
analyzed: puna capara gahapatayaḥ dussīlaḥ sīla vipanno kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati  ayam pañcamaḥ ādīnavaḥ dussīlassa sīla vipattiyā
translated: Furthermore, the unvirtuous person, with the breakup of the body, after death, is reborn in a state of misery, in a bad destination, in the nether world, in hell.🔽This is the fifth danger.

original: Ime kho, gahapatayo, pañca ādīnavā dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.🔽6. Sīlavantaānisaṁsa
analyzed: ime kho gahapatayo pañca ādīnavāḥ dussīlassa sīla vipattiyā  sīlavanta ānisasa
translated: These are the five dangers in the unvirtuous person’s failure in virtue.

original: Pañcime, gahapatayo, ānisaṁsā sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
analyzed: pañcime gahapatayaḥ ānisasā sīlavataḥ sīla sampadāya
translated: “Householders, there are these five rewards for one who is virtuous, for one endowed with virtue.

original: Katame pañca?
analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What are the five?

original: Idha, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno appamādādhikaraṇaṁ mahantaṁ bhogakkhandhaṁ adhigacchati.
analyzed: idha gahapatayaḥ sīlavā sīla sampannaḥ appamāda adhikaraṇam mahantam bhogakkhandham adhigacchati
translated: Here, a virtuous person, endowed with virtue, through heedfulness acquires a great mass of wealth.

original: Ayaṁ paṭhamo ānisaṁso sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
analyzed: ayam paṭhamaḥ ānisasaḥ sīlavataḥ sīla sampadāya
translated: This is the first reward for one who is virtuous, for one endowed with virtue.

original: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, sīlavato sīlasampannassa kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati.
analyzed: puna capara gahapatayo sīlavataḥ sīla sampannassa kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggacchati
translated: “Again, a virtuous person, endowed with virtue, has a good reputation.

original: Ayaṁ dutiyo ānisaṁso sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
analyzed: ayam dutiyaḥ ānisasaḥ sīlavataḥ sīla sampadāya
translated: This is the second reward for one who is virtuous, for one endowed with virtue.

original: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno yaññadeva parisaṁ upasaṅkamati—yadi
analyzed: puna capara gahapatayo sīlavā sīla sampannaḥ yaññat eva parisam upasaṅkamati yadi
translated: “Again, a virtuous person, endowed with virtue, has no regrets.

original: khattiyaparisaṁ yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṁ yadi gahapatiparisaṁ yadi samaṇaparisaṁ visārado🔽upasaṅkamati amaṅkubhūto.
analyzed: khattiya parisam yadi brāhmaṇa parisam yadi gahapati parisam yadi samaṇa parisam visāradaḥ  upasaṅkamati a maṅku bhūtaḥ
translated: whether it be an assembly of nobles, an assembly of brahmins, an assembly of householders, or an assembly of monks.

original: Ayaṁ tatiyo ānisaṁso sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
analyzed: ayam tatiyaḥ ānisasaḥ sīlavataḥ sīla sampadāya
translated: This is the third benefit for the virtuous from the accomplishment of virtue.

original: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno asammūḷho kālaṁ karoti.
analyzed: puna capara gahapatayaḥ sīlavā sīla sampannaḥ a sammūḍhaḥ kālam karoti
translated: “Again, householders, the virtuous one, accomplished in virtue, dies unconfused.

original: Ayaṁ catuttho ānisaṁso sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
analyzed: ayam catutthaḥ ānisasaḥ sīlavato sīla sampadāya
translated: This is the fourth benefit for the virtuous from the accomplishment of virtue.

original: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: puna capara gahapatayo sīlavā sīla sampanno kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: “Again, householders, the virtuous one, accomplished in virtue, on the breakup of the body, after death, reappears in a good destination, in the heavenly world.

original: Ayaṁ pañcamo ānisaṁso sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
analyzed: ayam pañcamaḥ ānisasaḥ sīlavataḥ sīla sampadāya
translated: This is the fifth benefit for the virtuous from the accomplishment of virtue.

original: Ime kho, gahapatayo, pañca ānisaṁsā sīlavato sīlasampadāyā”ti.🔽Atha kho bhagavā pāṭaligāmike upāsake bahudeva rattiṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uyyojesi:
analyzed: ime kho gahapatayaḥ pañca ānisasā sīlavataḥ sīla sampadā āyāti  atha kho bhagavā pāṭaligāmike upāsake bahu deva rattim dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uyyojesi
translated: These are the five benefits for the virtuous from the accomplishment of virtue.”🔽Then the Lord, having instructed, urged, roused, & encouraged the lay followers of Pataligama for a large part of the night with Dhamma talk, dismissed them, saying, “The night is far gone, householders. Do what you think it is now time to do.”

original: “abhikkantā kho, gahapatayo, ratti, yassadāni tumhe kālaṁ maññathā”ti.
analyzed: abhikkantāḥ kho gahapatayo ratti yassadāni tumhe kālam maññatha ati
translated: “Very well, lord,” the lay followers of Pataligama responded to the Lord. Then they, rising from their seats, bowing down to the Lord and circumambulating him, keeping him to their right, departed.

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavato paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkamiṁsu.
analyzed: eva bhanta iti kho pāṭaligāmikāḥ upāsakāḥ bhagavato paṭissutvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkamisu
translated: “Yes, lord,” they replied, and they rose from their seats, bowed down to him, circumambulated him, keeping him to their right, and left.

original: Atha kho bhagavā acirapakkantesu pāṭaligāmikesu upāsakesu suññāgāraṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā acira pakkantesu pāṭaligāmikesu upāsakesu suññāgāram pāvisi
translated: Then, not long after they had left, the Blessed One entered an empty building.

original: 7. Pāṭaliputtanagaramāpana
analyzed: pāṭaliputta nagara māpana
translated: . The Founding of Pāṭaliputta

original: Tena kho pana samayena sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā pāṭaligāme nagaraṁ māpenti vajjīnaṁ paṭibāhāya.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena sunidha vassa kārāḥ magadha mahāmattāḥ pāṭali gāme nagaram māpenti vajjīnam paṭibāhāya
translated: Now at that time Sunidha and Vassakāra, the chief ministers of Magadha, were building a fortress at Pāṭali Village to ward off the Vajjians.

original: Tena samayena sambahulā devatāyo sahasseva pāṭaligāme vatthūni pariggaṇhanti.🔽Yasmiṁ padese mahesakkhā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, mahesakkhānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.
analyzed: tena samayena sambahulāḥ devatāyaḥ sahassā iva pāṭaligāme vatthūni pariggaṇhanti  yasmin padese mahesakkhāḥ devatāḥ vatthūni pariggaṇhanti mahesakkhānam tattha raññam rāja mahāmattānam cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetu
translated: At that time, many deities by the thousands were taking possession of sites in Pāṭali Village.🔽In whatever place the most powerful deities took possession of a site, the minds of the most powerful kings and king-makers were inclined to build a residence there.

original: Yasmiṁ padese majjhimā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, majjhimānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.
analyzed: yasmin padese majjhimāḥ devatāḥ vatthūni pariggaṇhanti majjhimānam tattha raññam rāja mahāmattānam cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetu
translated: In whatever place the middle-ranking deities took possession of a site, the minds of the middle-ranking kings and king-makers were inclined to build a residence there.

original: Yasmiṁ padese nīcā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, nīcānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.
analyzed: yasmin padese nīcāḥ devatāḥ vatthūni pariggaṇhanti nīcānam tattha raññam rāja mahāmattānam cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetu
translated: In whatever place the lower spirits take possession of a site, there the minds of the lower kings and royal ministers tend to build.

original: Addasā kho bhagavā dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena tā devatāyo sahasseva pāṭaligāme vatthūni pariggaṇhantiyo.🔽Atha kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: addasā kho bhagavā dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena tāḥ devatāyaḥ sahassā iva pāṭaligāme vatthūni pariggaṇhantiyaḥ  atha kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsa samayam paccuṭṭhāya āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: And with his superhuman and divine eye, the Buddha saw those spirits taking possession of sites in the 500 places.

original: “Ke nu kho, ānanda, pāṭaligāme nagaraṁ māpentī”ti?
analyzed: ke nu khalu ānanda pāṭaligāme nagaram māpenti iti
translated: Then, rising from his seat in the middle of the day, he said to Ven. Ānanda, “Ānanda, who is building a city at Pāṭali Village?”

original: “Sunidhavassakārā, bhante, magadhamahāmattā pāṭaligāme nagaraṁ māpenti vajjīnaṁ paṭibāhāyā”ti.
analyzed: sunidha vassakārāḥ bhante magadha mahāmattā pāṭali gāme nagaram māpenti vajjīnam paṭibāhāya ati
translated: “Sunidha and Vassakāra, lord, the chief ministers of Magadha, are building a city at Pāṭali Village to ward off the Vajjians.”

original: “Seyyathāpi, ānanda, devehi tāvatiṁsehi saddhiṁ mantetvā;🔽evameva kho, ānanda, sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā pāṭaligāme nagaraṁ māpenti vajjīnaṁ paṭibāhāya.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api ānanda devehi tāvatisehi saddhim mantetvā 🔽evam eva khalu ānanda sunidha vassakārāḥ magadha mahāmattā pāṭali gāme nagaram māpenti vajjīnam paṭibāhāya
translated: “Ānanda, it’s as if they had consulted the Tāvatiṁsa devas,🔽and then built the city.

original: Idhāhaṁ, ānanda, addasaṁ dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena sambahulā devatāyo sahasseva pāṭaligāme vatthūni pariggaṇhantiyo.
analyzed: idha aham ānanda addasam dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena sambahulāḥ devatāyaḥ sahassā iva pāṭaligāme vatthūni pariggaṇhantiyaḥ
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I saw many thousands of deities taking possession of sites in Pāṭaliputta.

original: Yasmiṁ, ānanda, padese mahesakkhā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, mahesakkhānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.🔽Yasmiṁ padese majjhimā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, majjhimānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.
analyzed: yasmi ānanda padese mahesakkhāḥ devatāḥ vatthūni pariggaṇhanti mahesakkhānam tattha raññam rāja mahāmattānam cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetu  yasmin padese majjhimāḥ devatāḥ vatthūni pariggaṇhanti majjhimānam tattha raññam rāja mahāmattānam cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetu
translated: Wherever powerful deities took possession of sites, powerful kings and royal ministers took possession of sites nearby.🔽Wherever medium deities took possession of sites, medium kings and royal ministers took possession of sites nearby.

original: Yasmiṁ padese nīcā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, nīcānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.
analyzed: yasmin padese nīcāḥ devatāḥ vatthūni pariggaṇhanti nīcānam tattha raññam rāja mahāmattānam cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetu
translated: Wherever low-ranking deities took possession of sites, low-ranking kings and royal ministers took possession of sites nearby.

original: Yāvatā, ānanda, ariyaṁ āyatanaṁ yāvatā vaṇippatho idaṁ agganagaraṁ bhavissati pāṭaliputtaṁ puṭabhedanaṁ.
analyzed: yāvatā ānanda ariyam āyatanam yāvatā vaṇi pathaḥ idam agga nagaram bhavissati pāṭaliputtam puṭabhedana
translated: As far as the noble domain extends, as far as the ocean’s shore, as far as the Ganges River extends, this will be the chief city, Pāṭaliputta, the place where goods are collected.

original: Pāṭaliputtassa kho, ānanda, tayo antarāyā bhavissanti—
analyzed: pāṭaliputtassa kho ānanda tayaḥ antarāyāḥ bhavissanti
translated: There will be three dangers for Pāṭaliputta:

original: aggito vā udakato vā mithubhedā vā”ti.
analyzed: aggitaḥ vā udakataḥ vā mithu bhedāḥ vāti
translated: from fire, from water, and from the breaking of an alliance.”

original: Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu,🔽sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu, ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: atha kho sunidha vassakārāḥ magadha mahāmattāḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodisu  sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam aṭṭhasu ekamantam ṭhitāḥ kho sunidha vassakārāḥ magadha mahāmattāḥ bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: Then Sunīdha and Vassakāra went to the Buddha, exchanged pleasantries with him,

original: “adhivāsetu no bhavaṁ gotamo ajjatanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu naḥ bhavam gotamaḥ ajjatanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: and said, “Sir, please accept tomorrow’s meal from us together with the Sangha of monks.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.🔽Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā yena sako🔽āvasatho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā sake āvasathe paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena  atha kho sunidhavaḥ sakārāḥ magadha mahāmattāḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā yena sakaḥ  āvasathaḥ tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā sake āvasathe paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīya
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.🔽Then Sunīdha and Vassakāra, understanding that the Buddha had consented, went to their own rest house,

original: paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesuṁ:
analyzed: paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavataḥ kālam ārocāpesu
translated: where they had various kinds of fine food prepared. When everything was ready, they had the Buddha informed:🔽“Sir, it’s time for the meal.”

original: “kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
analyzed: kālaḥ bho gotama niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: “It’s time, Good Gotama, the meal is ready.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena🔽yena sunidhavassakārānaṁ magadhamahāmattānaṁ āvasatho tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena  yena sunidha vassakārānam magadha mahāmattānam āvasathaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā
translated: Then, after robing up in the morning, the Buddha took his bowl and robe

original: paññatte āsane nisīdi.🔽Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesuṁ sampavāresuṁ.
analyzed: paññatte āsane  atha kho sunidha vassakārāḥ magadha mahāmattāḥ buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesum sampavāresu
translated: and went to the dwelling of Sunīdha and Vassakāra, where he sat down on the prepared seat.🔽Sunīdha and Vassakāra served and satisfied the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha with their own hands.

original: Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho sunidha vassakārāḥ magadha mahāmattāḥ bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim aññataram nīcam āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: When the Buddha had finished his meal, they sat down to one side

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinne kho sunidhavassakāre magadhamahāmatte bhagavā imāhi gāthāhi anumodi:🔽“Yasmiṁ padese kappeti,🔽vāsaṁ paṇḍitajātiyo;🔽Sīlavantettha bhojetvā,🔽saññate brahmacārayo.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinne kho sunidhavassakāre magadha mahāmatte bhagavā imāhi gāthāhi anumodi 🔽yasmin padese kappeti 🔽vāsam 🔽sīlavantā itthā bhojetvā 🔽saññate brahmacārayo
translated: and the Buddha expressed his appreciation with these verses:

original: Yā tattha devatā āsuṁ,🔽tāsaṁ dakkhiṇamādise;🔽Tā pūjitā pūjayanti,
analyzed: yāḥ tattha devatāḥ āsu  tāsam dakkhiṇam ādise  tā pūjitā pūjayanti
translated: The deities who were there🔽he dedicated the offering to them.🔽When they are worshipped, they worship him;

original: mānitā mānayanti naṁ.
analyzed: mānitāḥ mānayanti na
translated: when they are honored, they honor him.

original: Tato naṁ anukampanti,
analyzed: tatas nam anukampanti
translated: They have compassion on him,

original: mātā puttaṁva orasaṁ;
analyzed: mātā puttave orasa
translated: as a mother on her own son.

original: Devatānukampito poso,
analyzed: devatā anukampitaḥ posaḥ
translated: A person who is favored by deities

original: sadā bhadrāni passatī”ti.
analyzed: sadā bhadrāni passati iti
translated: always sees what is auspicious.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā sunidhavassakāre magadhamahāmatte imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sunidhavassakāre magadha mahāmatte imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: Then, after expressing his appreciation with these verses, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā bhagavantaṁ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhā honti:
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sunidha vassakārāḥ magadha mahāmattāḥ bhagavantam piṭṭhitas piṭṭhitas anubandhāḥ honti
translated: Just then Sunīdha and Vassakāra were following behind the Buddha, thinking,

original: “yenajja samaṇo gotamo dvārena nikkhamissati, taṁ gotamadvāraṁ nāma bhavissati.
analyzed: yena ajja samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ dvārena nikkhamissati tat gotamadvāram nāma bhavissati
translated: “The gate by which the ascetic Gotama leaves will be called the Gotama Gate.

original: Yena titthena gaṅgaṁ nadiṁ tarissati, taṁ gotamatitthaṁ nāma bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: yena titthena gaṅgam nadim tarissati tam gotamatittham nāma bhavissati iti
translated: And the ford by which he crosses the Ganges will be called the Gotama Ford.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā yena dvārena nikkhami, taṁ gotamadvāraṁ nāma ahosi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā yena dvārena nikkhami tam gotamadvāram nāma ahosi
translated: The gate by which the Buddha left was called the Gotama Gate.

original: Atha kho bhagavā yena gaṅgā nadī tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā yena gaṅgā nadī tena upasaṅkami
translated: The Buddha then went to the river Ganges.

original: Tena kho pana samayena gaṅgā nadī pūrā hoti samatittikā kākapeyyā.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena gaṅgā nadī pūrā hoti sama tittikā kākapeyyā
translated: At that time the Ganges was full up to the banks, so that a crow could drink from it.

original: Appekacce manussā nāvaṁ pariyesanti, appekacce uḷumpaṁ pariyesanti, appekacce kullaṁ bandhanti apārā, pāraṁ gantukāmā.🔽Atha kho bhagavā—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ🔽vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—gaṅgāya nadiyā orimatīre antarahito pārimatīre paccuṭṭhāsi
analyzed: appekacce manussāḥ nāvam pariyesanti appekacce uḷumpam pariyesanti appekacce kullam bandhanti apārā pāram gantu kāmā  atha khalu bhagavān aseyyathā api nāma balavā purisaḥ samiñjitam vā bāham pasāreyya pasārita  vā bāham samiñjeyya evam eva gaṅgāya nadiyāḥ orima tīre antarahitaḥ pārima tīre paccuṭṭhāsi
translated: Some people were looking for boats, some were looking for floats, and some were binding rafts in a bid to go from this shore to the other.

original: saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.
analyzed: saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: Then, just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm, the Buddha disappeared from the near bank of the Ganges and reappeared on the far bank, together with the community of monks.

original: Addasā kho bhagavā te manusse appekacce nāvaṁ pariyesante appekacce uḷumpaṁ pariyesante appekacce kullaṁ bandhante apārā pāraṁ gantukāme.
analyzed: addasā kho bhagavā te manusse appekacce nāvam pariyesante appekacce uḷumpam pariyesante appekacce kullam bandhante apārā pāram gantu kāme
translated: He saw those people looking for boats, floats, and rafts.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etam attham viditvā tāyam velāyam imam udānam udānesi
translated: Knowing this, on that occasion the Buddha spoke this verse:

original: “Ye taranti aṇṇavaṁ saraṁ,
analyzed: ye taranti anṇavam sara
translated: “Those who cross the ocean, the lake,

original: Setuṁ katvāna visajja pallalāni;
analyzed: setum katvāna visajja pallalāni
translated: Having built a bridge and left the swamps,

original: Kullañhi jano bandhati,
analyzed: kullam hi janaḥ bandhati
translated: People bind a raft.

original: Tiṇṇā medhāvino janā”ti.
analyzed: tiṇṇā medhāvinaḥ janāti
translated: The wise ones have crossed over.”

original: Paṭhamabhāṇavāro.
analyzed: paṭhama bhāṇavāro
translated: The first recitation section.

original: 8. Ariyasaccakathā
analyzed: ariya sacca kathā
translated: The Four Noble Truths

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: Then the Lord addressed the venerable Ānanda, saying:

original: “āyāmānanda, yena koṭigāmo tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
analyzed: āyāma ānanda yena koṭigāmaḥ tena upasaṅkamissāma ati
translated: “Come Ānanda, let us approach Koṭigāma.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Very well, Lord,” venerable Ānanda replied to the Lord.

original: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena koṭigāmo tadavasari.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim yena koṭigāmaḥ tat avasari
translated: Then the Lord together with a great company of monks arrived at Koṭigāma.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā koṭigāme viharati.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā koṭigāme viharati
translated: There the Lord stayed at Koṭigāma.

original: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There the Lord addressed the monks, saying:

original: “Catunnaṁ, bhikkhave, ariyasaccānaṁ ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
analyzed: bhikkhave ariya saccānam ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evam idam dīgham addhānam sandhāvitam sa saritam mamañca iva tumhākañca
translated: “Monks, it is through not fully understanding, not penetrating four things that I, and you, have for a long time fared on round the cycle of rebirths.

original: Katamesaṁ catunnaṁ?
analyzed: katamesam
translated: What are the four?

original: Dukkhassa, bhikkhave, ariyasaccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
analyzed: dukkhassa bhikkhave ariya saccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evam idam dīgham addhānam sandhāvitam sa saritam mamañca iva tumhākañca
translated: It is through not fully understanding, not penetrating the Noble Truth of Suffering that I, and you, have for a long time fared on round the cycle of rebirths.

original: Dukkhasamudayassa, bhikkhave, ariyasaccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.🔽Dukkhanirodhassa, bhikkhave, ariyasaccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
analyzed: dukkha samudayassa bhikkhave ariya saccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evam idam dīgham addhānam sandhāvitam sa saritam mamañca iva tumhākañca  dukkha nirodhassa bhikkhave ariya saccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evam idam dīgham addhānam sandhāvitam sa saritam mamañca iva tumhākañca
translated: Because, bhikkhus, the noble truth of the origin of suffering has not been fully understood …🔽Because, bhikkhus, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering has not been fully understood …

original: Dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya, bhikkhave, ariyasaccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.🔽Tayidaṁ, bhikkhave, dukkhaṁ ariyasaccaṁ anubuddhaṁ paṭividdhaṁ, dukkhasamudayaṁ ariyasaccaṁ
analyzed: dukkha nirodha gāminiyā paṭipadāya bhikkhave ariya saccassa an anubodhā appaṭivedhā evam idam dīgham addhānam sandhāvitam sa saritam mamañca iva tumhākañca  bhikkhave dukkham ariya saccam anubuddham paṭividdha dukkha samudayam ariya sacca
translated: Because, bhikkhus, the noble truth of the way leading to the cessation of suffering has not been fully understood …🔽“But, bhikkhus, this noble truth of suffering has been fully understood …

original: anubuddhaṁ paṭividdhaṁ, dukkhanirodhaṁ ariyasaccaṁ anubuddhaṁ paṭividdhaṁ, dukkhanirodhagāminī
analyzed: anubuddham paṭividdha dukkha nirodham ariya saccam anubuddham paṭividdha dukkha nirodha gāminī
translated: This noble truth of the way leading to the cessation of suffering has been developed …

original: paṭipadā ariyasaccaṁ anubuddhaṁ paṭividdhaṁ, ucchinnā bhavataṇhā, khīṇā bhavanetti,
analyzed: paṭipadā ariya saccam anubuddham paṭividdhaḥ ucchinnā bhava taṇhā khīṇā bhava netti
translated: Craving for existence has been cut off; the guide to continuation has been destroyed;🔽now there is no continuation of existence.”

original: natthi dāni punabbhavo”ti.
analyzed: natthi dāni punabbhavaḥ ti
translated: There is no continuation in existence.”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: This is what the Blessed One said.

original: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato athāparaṁ etadavoca satthā:🔽“Catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ,
analyzed: idam vatvāna sugataḥ atha aparam etat avoca satthā  catunnam
translated: Having said this, the One Well-Gone, the Teacher, further said this:🔽“Because of not seeing🔽the four noble truths

original: yathābhūtaṁ adassanā;
analyzed: yathābhūtam adassanā
translated: as they really are,

original: Saṁsitaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ,
analyzed: sasitam dīgham addhāna
translated: one wanders a long time

original: tāsu tāsveva jātisu.
analyzed: tāsu tāsu eva jātisu
translated: in this very birth-and-death cycle.

original: Tāni etāni diṭṭhāni,
analyzed: tāni etāni diṭṭhāni
translated: But now that they have been seen,

original: bhavanetti samūhatā;
analyzed: samūha tā
translated: the door to existence is destroyed.

original: Ucchinnaṁ mūlaṁ dukkhassa,
analyzed: ucchinnam mūlam dukkhassa
translated: The root of suffering is cut off;

original: natthi dāni punabbhavo”ti.
analyzed: natthi dāni punabbhavaḥ ti
translated: there is no continuation in existence.”

original: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā koṭigāme viharanto etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
analyzed: tatra api sudam bhagavā koṭigāme viharantaḥ etat eva bahulam bhikkhūnam dhammim katham karoti
