original: Atha kho bhagavā maggā okkamma yena aññataraṁ rukkhamūlaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā maggā okkamma yena aññataram rukkha mūlam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: Then the Blessed One, leaving the road, went to the root of a certain tree and, on arrival, addressed Ven. Ānanda,

original: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, ānanda, catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapehi, kilantosmi, ānanda, nisīdissāmī”ti.
analyzed: me tvaṃ ānanda catugguṇam saṅghāṭim paññapehi kilantaḥ asmi ānanda nisīdissāmi iti
translated: “Come, Ānanda. Spread out my outer robe folded in four. I am tired. I will sit down.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapesi.🔽Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane.🔽Nisajja kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paṭissutvā catugguṇam saṅghāṭim paññapesi  nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane  nisajja khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: “Yes, lord,” Ven. Ānanda responded, and he arranged the outer robe in four layers.🔽The Blessed One sat down on the seat prepared for him.🔽Seated, he said to Ven. Ānanda,

original: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, ānanda, pānīyaṁ āhara, pipāsitosmi, ānanda, pivissāmī”ti.🔽Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: me tvam ānanda pānīyam āhara pipāsitaḥ asmi ānanda pivissāmi iti  evam vutte āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: “Yes, Venerable Sir,” Ven. Ānanda replied. Arranging the outer robe over one shoulder, he extended his hand in salutation and said to the Blessed One, “May the Blessed One come, lord, to the river Kakutthā. The river Kakutthā is not far from here. The river Kakutthā is delightful, pleasing, & full of water. The river Kakutthā is not far away. There the Blessed One can drink the water & cool his limbs.”

original: “idāni, bhante, pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni atikkantāni, taṁ cakkacchinnaṁ udakaṁ parittaṁ luḷitaṁ āvilaṁ sandati.🔽Ayaṁ, bhante, kakudhā nadī avidūre acchodakā sātodakā sītodakā setodakā suppatitthā ramaṇīyā.
analyzed: idāni bhante pañcamattāni sakaṭa satāni atikkantāni tam cakkacchinnam udakam parittam luḷitam āvilam sandati  aya bhante kakudhā nadī avidūre acchodakā sāta udakā sīta udakā seta udakā suppatitthā ramaṇīyā
translated: When this was said, Ven. Ānanda said to the Blessed One, “Just now, lord, five hundred carts have passed through. The water is churned up by the wheels, so that it is turbid, disturbed, & muddy.

original: Ettha bhagavā pānīyañca pivissati, gattāni ca sītī karissatī”ti.🔽Dutiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: ettha bhagavā pānīyañca pivissati gattāni ca sītī karissati iti  dutiyam pi khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: But the river Vaggumudā is not far from here. The river Vaggumudā is delightful, pleasing, & full of water. The river Vaggumudā is not far away. There the Blessed One can drink the water & cool his limbs.”🔽A second time, the Blessed One said to Ven. Ānanda, “I am thirsty, Ānanda. Bring me some water to drink.”

original: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, ānanda, pānīyaṁ āhara, pipāsitosmi, ānanda, pivissāmī”ti.
analyzed: me tvam ānanda pānīyam āhara pipāsitaḥ asmi ānanda pivissāmi iti
translated: A second time, Ven. Ānanda said to the Blessed One, “Just now, lord, five hundred carts have passed through. The water is churned up by the wheels, so that it is turbid, disturbed, & muddy.🔽But the river Vaggumudā is not far from here. The river Vaggumudā is delightful, pleasing, & full of water. The river Vaggumudā is not far away. There the Blessed One can drink the water & cool his limbs.”

original: Dutiyampi kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: dutiyam pi khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: A second time, Ānanda said to the Buddha,

original: “idāni, bhante, pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni atikkantāni, taṁ cakkacchinnaṁ udakaṁ parittaṁ luḷitaṁ āvilaṁ sandati.
analyzed: idāni bhante pañcamattāni sakaṭa satāni atikkantāni tam cakkacchinnam udakam parittam luḷitam āvilam sandati
translated: “Just now, Lord, five hundred carts have passed by. The water that has been churned up by the wheels is a little way off, limited, and flowing.

original: Ayaṁ, bhante, kakudhā nadī avidūre acchodakā sātodakā sītodakā setodakā suppatitthā ramaṇīyā.
analyzed: aya bhante kakudhā nadī avidūre acchodakā sāta udakā sīta udakā seta udakā suppatitthā ramaṇīyā
translated: But, Lord, the Kakutthā River is not far away. Its water is clear, pleasing, and cool, and it has good fords and is delightful.

original: Ettha bhagavā pānīyañca pivissati, gattāni ca sītīkarissatī”ti.
analyzed: ettha bhagavā pānīyam ca pivissati gattāni ca sītīkarissati iti
translated: There the Blessed One can drink water and cool his limbs.”

original: Tatiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: tatiyam pi khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: A third time, the Buddha said to Ānanda,

original: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, ānanda, pānīyaṁ āhara, pipāsitosmi, ānanda, pivissāmī”ti.
analyzed: me tvam ānanda pānīyam āhara pipāsitaḥ asmi ānanda pivissāmi iti
translated: “Ānanda, please bring me some water. I’m thirsty and want to drink.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā pattaṁ gahetvā yena sā nadikā tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: eva bhanta iti kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paṭissutvā pattam gahetvā yena sā nadikā tena upasaṅkami
translated: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied. He took his bowl and went to the river.

original: Atha kho sā nadikā cakkacchinnā parittā luḷitā āvilā sandamānā, āyasmante ānande upasaṅkamante acchā vippasannā anāvilā sandittha.
analyzed: atha kho sā nadikā cakka chinnā parittā luḷitā āvilā sandamānā āyasmante ānande upasaṅkamante acchā vippasannā anāvilā
translated: But the river, which had been churned up by the wheels, was limited, and flowing turbid and disturbed. But as Ānanda approached, it became clear, sparkling, and undisturbed.

original: Atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ ānandassa etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to the venerable Ānanda:

original: “acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā.
analyzed: acchariyam vata bho abbhutam vata bho tathāgatassa mahiddhika tā mahā anubhāva tā
translated: “How amazing! How astounding! The Great Ascetic has such psychic power, has such power and might!

original: Ayañhi sā nadikā cakkacchinnā parittā luḷitā āvilā sandamānā mayi upasaṅkamante acchā vippasannā anāvilā sandatī”ti.
analyzed: ayan hi sā nadikā cakka chinnā parittā luḷitā āvilā sandamānā mayi upasaṅkamante acchā vippasannā anāvilā sandati iti
translated: For this stream, cut off by the wheel, was flowing along turbid, disturbed, and muddy, but as I approached it flowed clear, serene, and calm.”

original: Pattena pānīyaṁ ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: pattena pānīyam ādāya yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He took the water in his bowl, approached the Blessed One, and said to him:

original: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā.
analyzed: acchariya bhante abbhuta bhante tathāgatassa mahiddhika tā mahā anubhāva tā
translated: “How amazing! How astounding! The Great Ascetic has such psychic power, has such power and might!

original: Idāni sā bhante nadikā cakkacchinnā parittā luḷitā āvilā sandamānā mayi upasaṅkamante acchā vippasannā anāvilā sandittha.
analyzed: idāni sā bhante nadikā cakka chinnā parittā luḷitā āvilā sandamānā mayi upasaṅkamante acchā vippasannā anāvilā
translated: For this stream, cut off by the wheel, was flowing along turbid, disturbed, and muddy, but as I approached it flowed clear, serene, and calm.

original: Pivatu bhagavā pānīyaṁ pivatu sugato pānīyan”ti.
analyzed: pivatu bhagavā pānīyam pivatu sugataḥ pānīya nti
translated: May the Blessed One drink the water, may the Sublime One drink the water!”

original: Atha kho bhagavā pānīyaṁ apāyi.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā pānīyam apāyi
translated: Then the Blessed One drank the water.

original: 25. Pukkusamallaputtavatthu
analyzed: pukkusamallaputtavatthu
translated: The Case of Pukkusāti

original: Tena kho pana samayena pukkuso mallaputto āḷārassa kālāmassa sāvako kusinārāya pāvaṁ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti.🔽Addasā kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavantaṁ aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle nisinnaṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena pukkusaḥ malla putto āḷārassa kālāmassa sāvakaḥ kusinārāya pāvam addhāna magga ppaṭipannaḥ hoti  addasā kho pukkusaḥ malla puttaḥ bhagavantam aññatarasmim rukkha mūle
translated: At that time Pukkusa Mallaputta, a disciple of Alara Kalama, was traveling from Kusinārā to Pāvā.🔽He saw the Buddha sitting at the foot of a tree.

original: Disvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho pukkusaḥ malla puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He went up to him, bowed, sat down,🔽and said, “It’s amazing, Sir, it’s astounding,

original: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, santena vata, bhante, pabbajitā vihārena viharanti.
analyzed: acchariya bhante abbhuta bhante santena vata bhante pabbajitāḥ vihārena viharanti
translated: how peaceful the life of one gone forth is.

original: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhante, āḷāro kālāmo addhānamaggappaṭipanno maggā okkamma avidūre aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: bhūta pubba bhante āḷāraḥ kālāmaḥ addhāna magga ppaṭipanno maggā okkamma avidūre aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi
translated: Once, when Alara Kalama was traveling on the road, he left the road, sat down cross-legged at the foot of a tree,🔽and entered an immersion that lasted for seven days.

original: Atha kho, bhante, pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ nissāya nissāya atikkamiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho bhante pañcamattāni sakaṭa satāni āḷāram kālāmam nissāya nissāya atikkamisu
translated: Five hundred carts passed by not far from him.

original: Atha kho, bhante, aññataro puriso tassa sakaṭasatthassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito āgacchanto yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho bhante aññataraḥ puriso tassa sakaṭasatthassa piṭṭhitaḥ piṭṭhitaḥ āgacchantaḥ yena āḷāraḥ kālāmo tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āḷāram kālāmam etat avoca
translated: Then a man who was following behind that caravan went to Āḷāra Kālāma and said to him:

original: ‘api, bhante, pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni atikkantāni addasā’ti?
analyzed: api bhante pañcamattāni sakaṭa satāni atikkantāni addasāti
translated: ‘Sir, did you see five hundred carts pass by?’

original: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, addasan’ti.
analyzed: na khalu aha āvuso addasanti
translated: ‘No, friend, I didn’t see them.’

original: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, saddaṁ assosī’ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante saddam assosi iti
translated: ‘But did you hear the sound of the carts?’

original: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, saddaṁ assosin’ti.
analyzed: na kho aha āvuso saddam assosinti
translated: ‘No, friend, I didn’t hear it.’

original: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, sutto ahosī’ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante sutto ahosi iti
translated: ‘But were you asleep, sir?’

original: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, sutto ahosin’ti.
analyzed: na kho aha āvuso sutto ahosinti
translated: ‘No, friend, I wasn’t asleep.’

original: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, saññī ahosī’ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante saññī ahosi iti
translated: ‘But were you conscious, sir?’

original: ‘Evamāvuso’ti.
analyzed: evam āvuso iti
translated: ‘Yes, friend.’

original: ‘So tvaṁ, bhante, saññī samāno jāgaro pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni neva addasa, na pana saddaṁ assosi;
analyzed: saḥ tva bhante saññī samānaḥ jāgaro pañcamattāni sakaṭa satāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni na iva addasa na pana saddam assosi
translated: ‘So, sir, you were conscious, awake, and yet you neither saw nor heard five hundred carts passing by one after another right next to you.

original: apisu te, bhante, saṅghāṭi rajena okiṇṇā’ti?
analyzed: apisu te bhante saṅghāṭi rajena okiṇṇāti
translated: But your outer robe is covered in dust.’

original: ‘Evamāvuso’ti.
analyzed: evam āvuso iti
translated: ‘Yes, friend.’

original: Atha kho, bhante, tassa purisassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho bhante tassa purisassa etat ahosi
translated: Then the man thought:

original: ‘acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, santena vata bho pabbajitā vihārena viharanti.
analyzed: acchariyam vata bho abbhutam vata bho santena vata bho pabbajitāḥ vihārena viharanti
translated: ‘It’s amazing, it’s astounding, how well these monastics live in a secluded state.

original: Yatra hi nāma saññī samāno jāgaro pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni neva dakkhati, na pana saddaṁ sossatī’ti.
analyzed: yatra hi nāma saññī samānaḥ jāgaraḥ pañcamattāni sakaṭa satāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni na iva dakkhati na pana saddam sossati iti
translated: For while being conscious and awake, they didn’t see or hear the five hundred carts passing close by.’

original: Āḷāre kālāme uḷāraṁ pasādaṁ pavedetvā pakkāmī”ti.
analyzed: āḷāre kālāme uḷāram pasādam pavedetvā pakkāmi iti
translated: And after expressing his appreciation to Āḷāra Kālāma, he left.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, pukkusa,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi pukkusa
translated: “What do you think, Pukkusa?

original: katamaṁ nu kho dukkarataraṁ vā durabhisambhavataraṁ vā—
analyzed: katamam nu khalu dukkarataram vā durabhisambhavataram vā
translated: Which is more difficult to do or attain:

original: yo vā saññī samāno jāgaro pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni neva passeyya, na pana saddaṁ suṇeyya;
analyzed: yaḥ vā saññī samānaḥ jāgaraḥ pañcamattāni sakaṭa satāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni na iva passeyya na pana saddam suṇeyya
translated: that a conscious and awake person, while five hundred carts are passing close by, neither sees nor hears them;

original: yo vā saññī samāno jāgaro deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva passeyya, na pana saddaṁ suṇeyyā”ti?
analyzed: yaḥ vā saññī samānaḥ jāgaraḥ deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā na iva passeyya na pana saddam suṇeyya ati
translated: or that a conscious and awake person, while the gods are raining and lightning is flashing and thunder is rumbling, neither sees nor hears it?”

original: “Kiñhi, bhante, karissanti pañca vā sakaṭasatāni cha vā sakaṭasatāni satta vā sakaṭasatāni aṭṭha vā sakaṭasatāni nava vā sakaṭasatāni, sakaṭasahassaṁ vā sakaṭasatasahassaṁ vā.
analyzed: kim hi bhante karissanti pañca vā sakaṭa satāni cha vā sakaṭa satāni satta vā sakaṭa satāni aṭṭha vā sakaṭa satāni nava vā sakaṭa satāni sakaṭa sahassam vā sakaṭa sata sahassam vā
translated: “What can five hundred carts, or six, or seven, or eight, or nine, or a thousand carts do?

original: Atha kho etadeva dukkaratarañceva durabhisambhavatarañca yo saññī samāno jāgaro deve🔽vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva passeyya,
analyzed: atha kho etat eva dukkaratarañca ca iva durabhisambhavatarañca yaḥ saññī samānaḥ jāgaraḥ deve  vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā na iva passeyya
translated: It’s more difficult and more challenging for a person who’s conscious and awake🔽to not see or hear

original: na pana saddaṁ suṇeyyā”ti.
analyzed: na pana saddam suṇeyya ati
translated: when it’s raining and the rain is splashing down, with lightning flashes lighting up the sky and thunder cracking it open.”

original: “Ekamidāhaṁ, pukkusa, samayaṁ ātumāyaṁ viharāmi bhusāgāre.
analyzed: ekam id āha pukkusa samayam viharāmi bhusāgāre
translated: “Once, Pukkusa, I was staying at Ātumā in the Bhusāgāra.

original: Tena kho pana samayena deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā avidūre bhusāgārassa dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā avidūre bhusāgārassa dve kassakāḥ bhātaraḥ hatā cattāro ca balibaddāḥ
translated: On that occasion, while it was raining and the rain was splashing down, with lightning flashes lighting up the sky and thunder cracking it open, two brothers, farmers, were killed not far from the Bhusāgāra, along with four oxen.

original: Atha kho, pukkusa, ātumāya mahājanakāyo nikkhamitvā yena te dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho pukkusaḥ ātumāya mahā jana kāyaḥ nikkhamitvā yena te dve kassakāḥ bhātaraḥ hatā cattāro ca balibaddā tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then a large crowd of people from Ātumā left the city and went to where the two brothers and the four oxen had been killed.

original: Tena kho panāhaṁ, pukkusa, samayena bhusāgārā nikkhamitvā bhusāgāradvāre abbhokāse caṅkamāmi.
analyzed: tena kho pana aha pukkusa samayena bhusāgārā nikkhamitvā bhusāgāra dvāre abbhokāse caṅkamāmi
translated: And on that occasion I had left the hut and was walking back and forth in the open.

original: Atha kho, pukkusa, aññataro puriso tamhā mahājanakāyā yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā🔽maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitaṁ kho ahaṁ, pukkusa, taṁ purisaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: atha kho pukkusa aññataraḥ puriso tamhā mahā jana kāyā yena aham tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā  mam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi ekamantam ṭhitam kho aha pukkusa tam purisam etat avoca
translated: Then a certain man from the crowd went to me,

original: ‘kiṁ nu kho eso, āvuso, mahājanakāyo sannipatito’ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho eso āvuso mahā jana kāyo sannipatito ti
translated: bowed down to me, and stood to one side. As he was standing there, I said to him, ‘Why, friend, has this large crowd of people gathered?’

original: ‘Idāni, bhante, deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā.
analyzed: idāni bhante deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaraḥ hatā cattāraḥ ca balibaddā
translated: ‘Just now, lord, while it was raining and a thunderstorm was rumbling and lightning was flashing and thunder was crashing, two brothers were killed, along with four oxen.

original: Ettheso mahājanakāyo sannipatito.
analyzed: ettha iso mahā jana kāyo sannipatito
translated: That’s why this large crowd of people has gathered.

original: Tvaṁ pana, bhante, kva ahosī’ti?
analyzed: tvam pana bhante kva ahosi iti
translated: But where were you, lord?’

original: ‘Idheva kho ahaṁ, āvuso, ahosin’ti.
analyzed: idhā iva khalu aha āvuso
translated: ‘Right here, friend.’

original: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, addasā’ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante addasāti
translated: ‘But did you see it, Sir?’

original: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, addasan’ti.
analyzed: na khalu aha āvuso addasanti
translated: ‘No, I didn’t see it.’

original: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, saddaṁ assosī’ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante saddam assosi iti
translated: ‘But did you hear it, Sir?’

original: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, saddaṁ assosin’ti.
analyzed: na kho aha āvuso saddam assosinti
translated: ‘No, I didn’t hear it.’

original: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, sutto ahosī’ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante sutto ahosi iti
translated: ‘But were you asleep, Sir?’

original: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, sutto ahosin’ti.
analyzed: na kho aha āvuso sutto ahosinti
translated: ‘No, I wasn’t asleep.’

original: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, saññī ahosī’ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante saññī ahosi iti
translated: ‘But were you conscious, Sir?’

original: ‘Evamāvuso’ti.
analyzed: evam āvuso iti
translated: ‘Yes, I was conscious.’

original: ‘So tvaṁ, bhante, saññī samāno jāgaro deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva addasa, na pana saddaṁ assosī’ti?
analyzed: saḥ tva bhante saññī samānaḥ jāgaraḥ deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā na iva addasa na pana saddam assosi iti
translated: ‘So, Sir, you were conscious and awake, and you neither saw nor heard anything?’

original: ‘Evamāvuso’ti?
analyzed: evam āvuso iti
translated: ‘Yes, that’s right.’

original: Atha kho, pukkusa, tassa purisassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho pukkusa tassa purisassa etat ahosi
translated: Then that man thought,

original: ‘acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, santena vata bho pabbajitā vihārena viharanti.
analyzed: acchariyam vata bho abbhutam vata bho santena vata bho pabbajitāḥ vihārena viharanti
translated: ‘It’s incredible, it’s amazing! These monastics live so peacefully.

original: Yatra hi nāma saññī samāno jāgaro deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva dakkhati, na pana saddaṁ sossatī’ti.
analyzed: yatra hi nāma saññī samānaḥ jāgaraḥ deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā na iva dakkhati na pana saddam sossati iti
translated: For how could someone like me, who is conscious and awake, not see or hear it when it was raining and storming, when lightning was flashing and thunder was crashing?”

original: Mayi uḷāraṁ pasādaṁ pavedetvā maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmī”ti.
analyzed: mayi uḷāram pasādam pavedetvā mam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi iti
translated: After showing me such high honor, he bowed down, circumambulated me with his right side toward me, and left.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, pukkuso mallaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte pukkusaḥ malla puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Pukkusa said to the Buddha,

original: “esāhaṁ, bhante, yo me āḷāre kālāme pasādo taṁ mahāvāte vā ophuṇāmi sīghasotāya vā nadiyā pavāhemi.
analyzed: esā aha bhante yaḥ me āḷāre kālāme pasādaḥ tam mahā vāte vā ophuṇāmi sīghasotāya vā nadiyā pavāhemi
translated: “Venerable Sir, I blow out the faith I had in Āḷāra Kālāma like a bubble of spittle.

original: Abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.🔽Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa🔽vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante  sā iyyathā api bhante nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa  vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Excellent, Sir! Excellent!

original: evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: Just as if one were to set upright what had been overturned, or were to reveal what had been hidden, or were to show the path to one who was lost, or were to bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what’s there— just so has the Buddha made the Teaching clear in many ways.

original: Esāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go for refuge to the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha of monks.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: Please accept me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

original: Atha kho pukkuso mallaputto aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho pukkusaḥ malla puttaḥ aññataram purisam āmantesi
translated: Pukkusa then told a man,

original: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, bhaṇe, siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ āharā”ti.
analyzed: me bhaṇe siṅgī vaṇṇam yuga maṭṭham dhāraṇīyam āharāti
translated: “Please bring me a pair of gold-colored upper and lower robes.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho so puriso pukkusassa mallaputtassa paṭissutvā taṁ siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ āhari.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho so purisaḥ pukkusassa malla puttassa paṭissutvā tam siṅgī vaṇṇam yuga maṭṭham dhāraṇīyam āhari
translated: “Yes, sir,” he replied. He did as asked and then returned to Pukkusa.

original: Atha kho pukkuso mallaputto taṁ siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ bhagavato upanāmesi:
analyzed: atha kho pukkusaḥ malla putto tam siṅgī vaṇṇam yuga maṭṭham dhāraṇīyam bhagavataḥ upanāmesi
translated: Pukkusa then offered that pair of gold-colored upper and lower robes to the Buddha,

original: “idaṁ, bhante, siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ, taṁ me bhagavā paṭiggaṇhātu anukampaṁ upādāyā”ti.
analyzed: bhante siṅgī vaṇṇam yuga maṭṭham tam me bhagavā paṭiggaṇhātu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: “Sir, please accept this pair of gold-colored upper and lower robes out of compassion for me.”

original: “Tena hi, pukkusa, ekena maṁ acchādehi, ekena ānandan”ti.
analyzed: tena hi pukkusa ekena mama acchādehi ekena ānandanti
translated: “Well then, Pukkusa, give one to me and one to Ānanda.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavato paṭissutvā ekena bhagavantaṁ acchādeti, ekena āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho pukkusaḥ malla puttaḥ bhagavataḥ paṭissutvā ekena bhagavantam acchādeti ekena āyasmantam ānanda
translated: “Yes, lord,” Pukkusa replied. He covered the Blessed One with one and Venerable Ānanda with the other.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pukkusaṁ mallaputtaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pukkusam malla puttam dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi
translated: Then the Blessed One instructed, urged, roused, & encouraged Pukkusa with a Dhamma talk.

original: Atha kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṁsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho pukkusaḥ malla puttaḥ bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitaḥ samādapitaḥ samuttejitaḥ sampahasitaḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
translated: Then Pukkusa, instructed, urged, roused, & encouraged by the Blessed One with a Dhamma talk, got up from his seat, bowed down to him, circumambulated him, keeping him to his right, and left.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando acirapakkante pukkuse mallaputte taṁ siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ bhagavato kāyaṁ upanāmesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ acira pakkante pukkuse malla putte tam siṅgī vaṇṇam yuga maṭṭham dhāraṇīyam bhagavataḥ kāyam upanāmesi
translated: Then, not long after Pukkusa had left, Ven. Ānanda brought out the pair of gold-colored, size-12 robes to cover the Blessed One’s body.

original: Taṁ bhagavato kāyaṁ upanāmitaṁ hataccikaṁ viya khāyati.
analyzed: tam bhagavataḥ kāyam upanāmitam hataccikam viya khāyati
translated: But when it was brought out and placed over the Blessed One’s body, it looked like a mass of charcoal.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then Ven. Ānanda said to the Blessed One,🔽“Lord, the Blessed One has reached total unbinding.

original: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, yāva parisuddho, bhante, tathāgatassa chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
analyzed: acchariya bhante abbhuta bhante yāva parisuddhaḥ bhante tathāgatassa chavi vaṇṇaḥ pariyodāto
translated: “It’s astonishing and amazing how pure and bright the Buddha’s skin appears.

original: Idaṁ, bhante, siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ bhagavato kāyaṁ upanāmitaṁ hataccikaṁ viya khāyatī”ti.
analyzed: idam bhante siṅgī vaṇṇam yuga maṭṭham dhāraṇīyam bhagavato kāyam upanāmitam hataccikam viya khāyati iti
translated: This pair of gold-colored robes placed on the Buddha’s body looks like charcoal.”

original: “Evametaṁ, ānanda, evametaṁ, ānanda, dvīsu kālesu ativiya tathāgatassa kāyo parisuddho hoti chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
analyzed: evam ete ānanda evam ete ānanda dvīsu kālesu ativiya tathāgatassa kāyo parisuddhaḥ hoti chavi vaṇṇaḥ pariyodāto
translated: “That’s right, Ānanda. That’s right. The Buddha’s skin is very pure and bright on two occasions.

original: Katamesu dvīsu?
analyzed: katamesu dvīsu
translated: What are they?

original: Yañca, ānanda, rattiṁ tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambujjhati, yañca rattiṁ anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyati.
analyzed: yañca ānanda rattim tathāgataḥ anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambujjhati yañca rattim an upādisesāya nibbāna dhātuyā parinibbāyati
translated: The night when the Buddha awakens to supreme perfect enlightenment and the night when he attains final extinguishment in the element of extinguishment without any remnant of existence.

original: Imesu kho, ānanda, dvīsu kālesu ativiya tathāgatassa kāyo parisuddho hoti chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
analyzed: imesu kho ānanda dvīsu kālesu ativiya tathāgatassa kāyo parisuddhaḥ hoti chavi vaṇṇaḥ pariyodāto
translated: On these two occasions the Buddha’s skin is very pure and bright.

original: Ajja kho panānanda, rattiyā pacchime yāme kusinārāyaṁ upavattane mallānaṁ sālavane antarena yamakasālānaṁ tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
analyzed: ajja kho pana ānanda rattiyā pacchime yāme kusinārāyam upavattane mallānam sālavane antarena yamakasālānam tathāgatassa parinibbānam bhavissati
translated: Today, in the last watch of the night, between a pair of twin sal trees in the sal grove of the Mallas at Kusinārā, the Tathāgata’s final nibbāna will take place.

original: Āyāmānanda, yena kakudhā nadī tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
analyzed: āyāma ānanda yena kakudhā nadī tena upasaṅkamissāma ati
translated: Come, Ānanda, let us approach the Kakutthā River.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, lord,” Ānanda replied.

original: Siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ,
analyzed: siṅgī vaṇṇam
translated: A pair of golden-colored robes,

original: pukkuso abhihārayi;
analyzed: pukkusaḥ abhihārayi
translated: Pukkusa offered to the Teacher.

original: Tena acchādito satthā,
analyzed: tena a chāditaḥ satthā
translated: The Teacher was covered with them,

original: hemavaṇṇo asobhathāti.
analyzed: hema vaṇṇaḥ asobhatha iti
translated: and he shone like a golden statue.

original: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena kakudhā nadī tenupasaṅkami;
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim yena kakudhā nadī tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then the Blessed One, together with a large Saṅgha of monks, approached the Kakutthā River.

original: upasaṅkamitvā kakudhaṁ nadiṁ ajjhogāhetvā nhatvā ca pivitvā ca paccuttaritvā yena🔽ambavanaṁ tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā kakudham nadim ajjhogāhetvā nhatvā ca pivitvā ca paccuttaritvā yena  ambavanam tena upasaṅkami
translated: Having approached, he entered the water, bathed, drank, and emerged.

original: Upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ cundakaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam cundakam āmantesi
translated: Then he approached the mango grove and addressed Ven. Cundaka,

original: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, cundaka, catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapehi, kilantosmi, cundaka, nipajjissāmī”ti.
analyzed: iṅgha me tva cundaka catugguṇam saṅghāṭim paññapehi kilantaḥ asmi cundaka nipajjissāmi iti
translated: “Cundaka, please arrange my outer robe folded in four. I’m tired and will sit down.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā cundako bhagavato paṭissutvā catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapesi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmā cundakaḥ bhagavataḥ paṭissutvā catugguṇam saṅghāṭim paññapesi
translated: “Yes, lord,” Ven. Cundaka responded. He then arranged the four-piece set of outer robe, upper robe, sarong, and bathing robe.

original: Atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ kappesi pāde pādaṁ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṁ manasikaritvā.🔽Āyasmā pana cundako tattheva bhagavato purato nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇena passena sīha seyyam kappesi pāde pādam accādhāya sataḥ sampajānaḥ uṭṭhāna saññam manasikaritvā  āyasmā pana cundako tattha iva bhagavato puratas nisīdi
translated: The Blessed One then lay down on his right side in the lion’s sleeping posture—foot on foot, mindful & alert—having resolved his mind to the thought of getting up.🔽But Ven. Cundaka sat right in front of the Blessed One.

original: Gantvāna buddho nadikaṁ kakudhaṁ,
analyzed: gantvāna buddhaḥ nadikam
translated: The Awakened One, having gone to the river Kakutthā,

original: Acchodakaṁ sātudakaṁ vippasannaṁ;
analyzed: accha udakam sātudakam vippasanna
translated: to the water that is clear, sweet, & undisturbed,

original: Ogāhi satthā akilantarūpo,
analyzed: ogāhi satthā a kilanta rūpaḥ
translated: the Teacher, unwearied, entered the water,

original: Tathāgato appaṭimo ca loke.
analyzed: tathāgataḥ appaṭimaḥ ca loke
translated: the Tathāgata, the one incomparable in the world.

original: Nhatvā ca pivitvā cudatāri satthā,
analyzed: nhatvā ca pivitvā cudatāri satthā
translated: Having bathed & drunk, the Teacher, having crossed over,

original: Purakkhato bhikkhugaṇassa majjhe;
analyzed: purakkhataḥ bhikkhu gaṇassa majjhe
translated: in the middle of the Saṅgha of monks,

original: Vattā pavattā bhagavā idha dhamme,
analyzed: vattā pavattā bhagavā idha dhamme
translated: the Blessed One, the one who practices what he teaches,

original: Upāgami ambavanaṁ mahesi.
analyzed: upāgami ambavanam mahā isi
translated: went to the mango grove, the great seer.

original: Āmantayi cundakaṁ nāma bhikkhuṁ,
analyzed: āmantayi cundakam nāma bhikkhu
translated: He addressed the monk named Cundaka:

original: Catugguṇaṁ santhara me nipajjaṁ;
analyzed: catugguṇam santhara me nipajja
translated: “Arrange my outer robe folded in four for me to lie down on.

original: So codito bhāvitattena cundo,
analyzed: saḥ coditaḥ bhāvitattena cundaḥ
translated: ” Urged by the one developed in concentration, Cundaka

original: Catugguṇaṁ santhari khippameva;
analyzed: catugguṇam santhari khippam eva
translated: quickly arranged the outer robe folded in four.

original: Nipajji satthā akilantarūpo,
analyzed: nipajji satthā a kilanta rūpaḥ
translated: The Teacher, unwearied, lay down,

original: Cundopi tattha pamukhe nisīdīti.
analyzed: cundo pi tattha pamukhe
translated: and Cunda should sit in front of me.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: “siyā kho panānanda, cundassa kammāraputtassa koci vippaṭisāraṁ uppādeyya:
analyzed: siyā kho pana ānanda cundassa kammāra puttassa koci vippaṭisāram uppādeyya
translated: “Now, Ānanda, someone might cause Cunda remorse, saying:

original: ‘tassa te, āvuso cunda, alābhā tassa te dulladdhaṁ, yassa te tathāgato pacchimaṁ piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā parinibbuto’ti.
analyzed: tassa te āvuso cunda alābhā tassa te dulladdha yassa te tathāgato pacchimam piṇḍapātam paribhuñjitvā parinibbutaḥ ti
translated: ‘It is no gain for you, friend Cunda, it is ill-done by you, in that the Realised One attained final Nibbāna after eating your last almsfood.’

original: Cundassa, ānanda, kammāraputtassa evaṁ vippaṭisāro paṭivinetabbo:
analyzed: cundassa ānanda kammāra puttassa evam vippaṭisāraḥ paṭivinetabbo
translated: “Ānanda, Cunda’s remorse should be dispelled in this way:

original: ‘tassa te, āvuso cunda, lābhā tassa te suladdhaṁ,
analyzed: tassa te āvuso cunda lābhā tassa te su laddha
translated: ‘It is a gain for you, friend Cunda, it is well-done by you,

original: yassa te tathāgato pacchimaṁ piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā parinibbuto.
analyzed: yassa te tathāgataḥ pacchimam piṇḍapātam paribhuñjitvā parinibbutaḥ
translated: in that the Realised One attained final Nibbāna after eating your last almsfood.

original: Sammukhā metaṁ, āvuso cunda, bhagavato sutaṁ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṁ:
analyzed: sammukhā mā itas āvuso cunda bhagavataḥ sutam sammukhā paṭiggahita
translated: I heard and learned this, friend Cunda, from the Lord’s own lips:

original: dveme piṇḍapātā samasamaphalā samavipākā, ativiya aññehi piṇḍapātehi mahapphalatarā ca mahānisaṁsatarā ca.
analyzed: dve me piṇḍapātā sama sama phalā sama vipākā ativiya aññehi piṇḍapātehi mahapphalatarā ca mahānisasatarā ca
translated: ‘There are these two almsfoods that are equal, of equal fruit, of greater fruit than any other almsfood.

original: Katame dve?
analyzed: katame dve
translated: What are the two?

original: Yañca piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambujjhati, yañca piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyati.
analyzed: yat ca piṇḍapātam paribhuñjitvā tathāgataḥ anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambujjhati yat ca piṇḍapātam paribhuñjitvā tathāgataḥ an upādisesāya nibbāna dhātuyā parinibbāyati
translated: The alms-food that the Tathāgata eats after arousing his mind to Supreme Perfect Awakening, and the alms-food that the Tathāgata eats after attaining Final Emancipation in the Emancipation-element which has no basis for attachment remaining.

original: Ime dve piṇḍapātā samasamaphalā samavipākā, ativiya aññehi piṇḍapātehi mahapphalatarā ca mahānisaṁsatarā ca.🔽Āyusaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, vaṇṇasaṁvattanikaṁ🔽āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, sukhasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena🔽kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, yasasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena
analyzed: ime dve piṇḍapātā sama sama phalā sama vipākā ativiya aññehi piṇḍapātehi mahapphalatarā ca mahānisasatarā ca  āyusavattanikam āyasmatā cundena kammāra puttena kammam upacita vaṇṇa savattanika  āyasmatā cundena kammāra puttena kammam upacita sukha savattanikam āyasmatā cundena  kammāraputtena kammam upacita yasa savattanikam āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena
translated: These two alms-foods have an equal result, an equal outcome, they are more excellent and perfect than other alms-foods.🔽The Fortunate One has accumulated the deed that leads to a long life, the Fortunate One has accumulated the deed that leads to beauty,

original: kammaṁ upacitaṁ, saggasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ,
analyzed: kammam upacita sagga savattanikam āyasmatā cundena kammāra puttena kammam upacita
translated: the Fortunate One has accumulated the deed that leads to happiness, the Fortunate One has accumulated the deed that leads to fame,

original: ādhipateyyasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitan’ti.
analyzed: ādhipateyya savattanikam āyasmatā cundena kammāra puttena kammam upacitanti
translated: the Fortunate One has accumulated the deed that leads to heaven, the Fortunate One has accumulated the deed that leads to lordship.”

original: Cundassa, ānanda, kammāraputtassa evaṁ vippaṭisāro paṭivinetabbo”ti.
analyzed: cundassa ānanda kammāra puttassa evam vippaṭisāraḥ paṭivinetabbo ti
translated: This is how Cunda the Smith should be corrected.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etam attham viditvā tāyam velāyam imam udānam udānesi
translated: Then, the Blessed One, having known this matter, on that occasion, uttered this exalted utterance:

original: “Dadato puññaṁ pavaḍḍhati,
analyzed: dadataḥ puññam pavaḍḍhati
translated: “For one who gives, merit increases.

original: Saṁyamato veraṁ na cīyati;🔽Kusalo ca jahāti pāpakaṁ,
analyzed: sayamataḥ vā iram na cīyati  kusalaḥ ca jahāti pāpaka
translated: Through restraint, hatred does not increase.🔽The skilled one abandons evil.

original: Rāgadosamohakkhayā sanibbuto”ti.
analyzed: rāga dosa moha khayā sa nibbutaḥ ti
translated: Through the destruction of passion, hatred, and delusion, he is well quenched.”

original: Catuttho bhāṇavāro.
analyzed: catutthaḥ bhāṇa vāro
translated: The fourth recitation section.

original: 26. Yamakasālā
analyzed: yamakasālā
translated: The Twin Sal Trees

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda, saying:

original: “āyāmānanda, yena hiraññavatiyā nadiyā pārimaṁ tīraṁ, yena kusinārā upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
analyzed: āyāma ānanda yena hiraññavatiyāḥ nadiyāḥ pārimam tīra yena kusinārāḥ upavattanam mallānam sālavanam tena upasaṅkamissāma ati
translated: “Come, Ānanda, let us cross to the farther bank of the Hiraññavati River and go to the Mallas’ Sala Grove, the Upavattana, near Kusinārā.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.🔽Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena hiraññavatiyā nadiyā pārimaṁ
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi  atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim yena hiraññavatiyā nadiyā pārima
translated: “Yes, Lord,” the venerable Ānanda replied to the Blessed One.

original: tīraṁ, yena kusinārā upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ tenupasaṅkami. upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: yena kusinārāḥ upavattanam mallānam sālavanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā
translated: Then the Blessed One together with a large number of monks crossed to the farther bank of the Hiraññavati River and went to the Mallas’ Sala Grove, the Upavattana, near Kusinārā.

original: āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: and he said to Ven. Ānanda,

original: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, ānanda, antarena yamakasālānaṁ uttarasīsakaṁ mañcakaṁ paññapehi, kilantosmi, ānanda, nipajjissāmī”ti.🔽“Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā antarena yamakasālānaṁ uttarasīsakaṁ mañcakaṁ paññapesi.
analyzed: me tvaṃ ānanda antarena yamaka sālānam uttara sīsakam mañcakam paññapehi kilantaḥ asmi ānanda nipajjissāmi iti  eva bhante iti kho āyasman ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ paṭissutvā antarena yamaka sālānam uttarasīsakam mañcakam paññapesi
translated: “Come, Ānanda. Between the twin sal trees, lay out the Tathāgata’s outer robe folded in four, with his head on the inside. The Tathāgata is tired and will lie down.”🔽Responding, “As you say, lord,” to the Blessed One, Ven. Ānanda between the twin sal trees laid out the Tathāgata’s outer robe folded in four, with his head on the inside.

original: Atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ kappesi pāde pādaṁ accādhāya sato sampajāno.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇena passena sīha seyyam kappesi pāde pādam accādhāya sataḥ sampajānaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, lying on his right side, took his last rest in the abode of awakening.

original: Tena kho pana samayena yamakasālā sabbaphāliphullā honti akālapupphehi.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena yamaka sālā sabba phāli phullāḥ honti akāla pupphehi
translated: Now at that time the twin sal trees were in full blossom out of season with flowers of every season.

original: Te tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
analyzed: te tathāgatassa sarīram okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya
translated: They rained down on the Tathāgata’s body and rained down all over the Tathāgata’s body and rained down all over the Tathāgata’s body in honor of the Tathāgata.

original: Dibbānipi mandāravapupphāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
analyzed: dibbāni api mandārava pupphāni antalikkhā papatanti tāni tathāgatassa sarīram okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya
translated: Divine coral tree flowers rained down from the sky, and they rained down on the Tathāgata’s body and rained down all over the Tathāgata’s body and rained down all over the Tathāgata’s body in honor of the Tathāgata.

original: Dibbānipi candanacuṇṇāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.🔽Dibbānipi tūriyāni antalikkhe vajjanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
analyzed: dibbāni api candana cuṇṇāni antalikkhā papatanti tāni tathāgatassa sarīram okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya  dibbāni api tūriyāni antalikkhe vajjanti tathāgatassa pūjāya
translated: Divine sandalwood powder rained down from the sky and fell on the Tathāgata’s body,🔽divine music played in the sky,

original: Dibbānipi saṅgītāni antalikkhe vattanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
analyzed: dibbāni api saṅgītāni antalikkhe vattanti tathāgatassa pūjāya
translated: and divine songs were sung in the sky, all in worship of the Tathāgata.

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam āmantesi
translated: The Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda,

original: “sabbaphāliphullā kho, ānanda, yamakasālā akālapupphehi.🔽Te tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
analyzed: sabba phāli phullā kho ānanda yamaka sālāḥ akāla pupphehi  te tathāgatassa sarīram okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya
translated: “Ānanda, the twin sala trees are in full bloom out of season.🔽They’re raining down on the Tathāgata’s body,

original: Dibbānipi mandāravapupphāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
analyzed: dibbāni api mandārava pupphāni antalikkhā papatanti tāni tathāgatassa sarīram okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya
translated: and divine coral tree flowers are raining down from the sky and falling on the Tathāgata’s body,

original: Dibbānipi candanacuṇṇāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.🔽Dibbānipi tūriyāni antalikkhe vajjanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
analyzed: dibbāni api candana cuṇṇāni antalikkhā papatanti tāni tathāgatassa sarīram okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya  dibbāni api tūriyāni antalikkhe vajjanti tathāgatassa pūjāya
translated: And celestial sandalwood powder rained down from the sky and fell on the Tathāgata’s body as an act of worship.🔽And celestial musical instruments played in the sky as an act of worship.

original: Dibbānipi saṅgītāni antalikkhe vattanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
analyzed: dibbāni api saṅgītāni antalikkhe vattanti tathāgatassa pūjāya
translated: And celestial songs were sung in the sky as an act of worship.

original: Na kho, ānanda, ettāvatā tathāgato sakkato vā hoti garukato vā mānito vā pūjito vā apacito vā.
analyzed: na kho ānanda ettāvatā tathāgataḥ sakkataḥ vā hoti garukataḥ vā mānitaḥ vā pūjitaḥ vā apacitaḥ vā
translated: But the Tathāgata is not worshipped, revered, honored, venerated, or given homage through material things.

original: Yo kho, ānanda, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā dhammānudhammappaṭipanno🔽viharati sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tathāgataṁ sakkaroti garuṁ karoti māneti
analyzed: yaḥ kho ānanda bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsakaḥ vā upāsikā vā dhamma anudhamma paṭipannaḥ  viharati sāmīci paṭipannaḥ anudhamma cārī saḥ tathāgatam sakkaroti garum karoti māneti
translated: But a monk, a nun, a male lay follower, or a female lay follower who practices in accordance with the Dhamma🔽and lives in accordance with the Dhamma worships the Tathāgata,

original: pūjeti apaciyati, paramāya pūjāya.
analyzed: pūjā iti paramāya pūjāya
translated: honors him, reveres him, venerates him, and pays him homage through the supreme homage.

original: Tasmātihānanda, dhammānudhammappaṭipannā viharissāma sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacārinoti.
analyzed: tasmā ati ha ānanda dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipannāḥ viharissāma sāmīci paṭipannāḥ anudhamma cārino ti
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, you should train yourselves thus: ‘We will practice in accordance with the Dhamma and live in accordance with the Dhamma.’

original: Evañhi vo, ānanda, sikkhitabban”ti.
analyzed: evam hi vaḥ ānanda sikkhitabbanti
translated: That’s how you should train yourselves.”

original: 27. Upavāṇatthera
analyzed: upavāṇatthera
translated: The Elder Upavāṇa

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upavāṇo bhagavato purato ṭhito hoti bhagavantaṁ bījayamāno.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena āyasmai upavāṇaḥ bhagavataḥ puratas ṭhitaḥ hoti bhagavantam bījayamānaḥ
translated: At that time Venerable Upavāṇa was standing in front of the Buddha, fanning him.

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāresi:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam upavāṇam apasāresi
translated: The Buddha told him to move away,

original: “apehi, bhikkhu, mā me purato aṭṭhāsī”ti.
analyzed: apehi bhikkhu mā me puratas aṭṭhāsi iti
translated: “Go away, monk, don’t stand in front of me.”

original: Atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ ānandassa etat ahosi
translated: Venerable Ānanda thought,

original: “ayaṁ kho āyasmā upavāṇo dīgharattaṁ bhagavato upaṭṭhāko santikāvacaro samīpacārī.
analyzed: ayam kho āyasmai upavāṇaḥ dīgharattam bhagavataḥ upaṭṭhāko santika avacaraḥ samīpa cārī
translated: “Venerable Upavāṇa has been the Buddha’s attendant for a long time, and he’s always been close to him.

original: Atha ca pana bhagavā pacchime kāle āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:🔽‘apehi, bhikkhu, mā me purato aṭṭhāsī’ti.🔽Ko nu kho hetu, ko paccayo, yaṁ bhagavā āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:
analyzed: atha ca pana bhagavā pacchime kāle āyasmantam upavāṇam apasāra iti  apehi bhikkhu mā me puratas aṭṭhāsi iti  kaḥ nu kho hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yam bhagavā āyasmantam upavāṇam apasāreti
translated: And yet the Buddha now tells him to move away.

original: ‘apehi, bhikkhu, mā me purato aṭṭhāsī’”ti?
analyzed: apehi bhikkhu mā me puratas aṭṭhāsi iti
translated: What’s the reason for that?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He then said to the Buddha,

original: “ayaṁ, bhante, āyasmā upavāṇo dīgharattaṁ bhagavato upaṭṭhāko santikāvacaro samīpacārī.
analyzed: bhante āyasmai upavāṇaḥ dīgharattam bhagavataḥ upaṭṭhāko santika avacaraḥ samīpa cārī
translated: “Sir, Venerable Upavāṇa has been the Buddha’s attendant for a long time, and he’s always been close to him.

original: Atha ca pana bhagavā pacchime kāle āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:
analyzed: atha ca pana bhagavā pacchime kāle āyasmantam upavāṇam apasāra iti
translated: But the Buddha has now sent him away, saying:

original: ‘apehi, bhikkhu, mā me purato aṭṭhāsī’ti.
analyzed: apehi bhikkhu mā me puratas aṭṭhāsi iti
translated: ‘Go away, monk, don’t stand in front of me.’

original: Ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo, yaṁ bhagavā āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yam bhagavā āyasmantam upavāṇam apasāreti
translated: What is the reason, sir, what is the cause,

original: ‘apehi, bhikkhu, mā me purato aṭṭhāsī’”ti?
analyzed: apehi bhikkhu mā me puratas aṭṭhāsi iti
translated: that the Buddha has sent him away?”

original: “Yebhuyyena, ānanda, dasasu lokadhātūsu devatā sannipatitā tathāgataṁ dassanāya.
analyzed: yebhuyyena ānanda dasasu lokadhātūsu devatā sannipatitā tathāgatam dassanāya
translated: “Ānanda, most of the gods from the ten world systems have gathered to see the Buddha.

original: Yāvatā, ānanda, kusinārā upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ samantato dvādasa yojanāni, natthi so padeso vālaggakoṭinittudanamattopi mahesakkhāhi devatāhi apphuṭo.
analyzed: yāvatā ānanda kusinārāḥ upavattanam mallānam sālavanam samantataḥ dvādasa yojanāni na atthi saḥ padesaḥ vālagga koṭi nittudana mattaḥ api mahesakkhāhi devatāhi apphuṭaḥ
translated: For twelve leagues all around the Mallas’ sal grove at Upavattana near Kusinārā there is not a spot even the size of the point of a hair that is not filled with powerful gods.

original: Devatā, ānanda, ujjhāyanti:
analyzed: devatāḥ ānande ujjhāyanti
translated: The gods are complaining:

original: ‘dūrā ca vatamha āgatā tathāgataṁ dassanāya.
analyzed: dūrā ca vatamhe āgatā tathāgatam dassanāya
translated: ‘We’ve come from far away to see the Buddha.

original: Kadāci karahaci tathāgatā loke uppajjanti arahanto sammāsambuddhā.
analyzed: kadāci karahaci tathāgatāḥ loke uppajjanti arahantaḥ sammāsambuddhāḥ
translated: Only rarely do Buddhas—awakened, perfected, fully clear, and completely awakened—appear in the world.

original: Ajjeva rattiyā pacchime yāme tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
analyzed: ajja iva rattiyā pacchime yāme tathāgatassa parinibbānam bhavissati
translated: Tonight, in the last watch of the night, the Buddha will attain final extinguishment.

original: Ayañca mahesakkho bhikkhu bhagavato purato ṭhito ovārento, na mayaṁ labhāma pacchime kāle tathāgataṁ dassanāyā’”ti.
analyzed: ayam ca mahesakkhaḥ bhikkhu bhagavato puratas ṭhitaḥ ovārentaḥ na mayam labhāma pacchime kāle tathāgatam dassanāya ati
translated: And this senior monk is standing in front of the Buddha, blocking the view. We won’t get to see the Buddha at the last moment.’”

original: “Kathaṁbhūtā pana, bhante, bhagavā devatā manasikarotī”ti?🔽“Santānanda, devatā ākāse pathavīsaññiniyo kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
analyzed: kathabhūtā pana bhante bhagavā devatāḥ manasikaroti iti  santa ānanda devatāḥ ākāse pathavī saññiniyaḥ kese pakiriya kandanti bāhā paggayha kandanti chinna pātam papatanti āvaṭṭanti vivaṭṭanti
translated: “But, Sir, what kind of gods does the Buddha think of?”

original: ‘atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antaradhāyissatī’ti.🔽Santānanda, devatā pathaviyaṁ pathavīsaññiniyo kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
analyzed: atikhippam bhagavā parinibbāyissati atikhippam sugataḥ parinibbāyissati atikhippam cakkhum loke antaradhāyissati iti  santā ānanda devatā pathaviyam pathavī saññiniyaḥ kese pakiriya kandanti bāhā paggayha kandanti chinna pātam papatanti āvaṭṭanti vivaṭṭanti
translated: “Ānanda, there are gods in the sky who perceive the earth with the earth perception, and they’re crying, tearing their hair, and falling down as if their feet were cut off. They cry, ‘Too soon the Blessed One will attain final extinguishment! Too soon the Well-gone will attain final extinguishment! Too soon the eye of the world will be extinguished!’

original: ‘atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antaradhāyissatī’ti.
analyzed: atikhippam bhagavā parinibbāyissati atikhippam sugataḥ parinibbāyissati atikhippam cakkhum loke antaradhāyissati iti
translated: There are gods on the earth who perceive the earth with the earth perception, and they’re crying, tearing their hair, and falling down as if their feet were cut off. They cry, ‘Too soon the Blessed One will attain final extinguishment! Too soon the Well-gone will attain final extinguishment! Too soon the eye of the world will be extinguished!’

original: Yā pana tā devatā vītarāgā, tā satā sampajānā adhivāsenti:
analyzed: yā pana tā devatā vīta rāgā tā satā sampajānā adhivāsenti
translated: But those deities who are free from lust tolerate it, mindful and clearly aware,

original: ‘aniccā saṅkhārā, taṁ kutettha labbhā’”ti.
analyzed: aniccā saṅkhārā tam kuta ittha
translated: thinking: ‘Fabrications are impermanent — how could it be otherwise?’”

original: 28. Catusaṁvejanīyaṭhāna
analyzed: catur sa vejanīya ṭhāna
translated: . Four Places of Spiritual Composure

original: “Pubbe, bhante, disāsu vassaṁvuṭṭhā bhikkhū āgacchanti tathāgataṁ dassanāya.
analyzed: pubbe bhante disāsu vassa vuṭṭhāḥ bhikkhū āgacchanti tathāgatam dassanāya
translated: “Previously, when monks who had completed the rains residence in various regions came to see the Tathāgata,

original: Te mayaṁ labhāma manobhāvanīye bhikkhū dassanāya, labhāma payirupāsanāya.
analyzed: te mayam labhāma manaḥ bhāvanīye bhikkhū dassanāya labhāma payirupāsanāya
translated: we had the opportunity to see inspiring monks and to attend on them.

original: Bhagavato pana mayaṁ, bhante, accayena na labhissāma manobhāvanīye bhikkhū dassanāya, na labhissāma payirupāsanāyā”ti.
analyzed: bhagavato pana maya bhante accayena na labhissāma manaḥ bhāvanīye bhikkhū dassanāya na labhissāma payirupāsanāya ati
translated: But after the Blessed One’s passing, we won’t have the opportunity to see inspiring monks and to attend on them.”

original: “Cattārimāni, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyāni saṁvejanīyāni ṭhānāni.
analyzed: cattārimāni ānanda saddhassa kula puttassa dassanīyāni savejanīyāni ṭhānāni
translated: “Ānanda, there are these four places that should be seen by a faithful person with conviction in order to arouse the spiritual composes.

original: Katamāni cattāri?
analyzed: katamāni cattāri
translated: What are the four?

original: ‘Idha tathāgato jāto’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
analyzed: idha tathāgataḥ jātaḥ ti ānanda saddhassa kula puttassa dassanīyam savejanīyam ṭhāna
translated: ‘Here the Tathāgata was born’ is a place that should be seen by a faithful person with conviction in order to arouse the spiritual composes.

original: ‘Idha tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.🔽‘Idha tathāgatena anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitan’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
analyzed: idha tathāgataḥ anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ ti ānanda saddhassa kula puttassa dassanīyam savejanīyam ṭhāna  idha tathāgatena anuttaram dhammacakkam pavattitanti ānanda saddhassa kula puttassa dassanīyam savejanīyam ṭhāna
translated: ‘Here the Realised One became fully awakened to the unsurpassed and Perfect Awakening’ is a place that inspires faith, Ānanda, for a faithful clansman.🔽‘Here the Realised One set rolling the unsurpassed Dhamma Wheel’ is a place that inspires faith, Ānanda, for a faithful clansman.

original: ‘Idha tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbuto’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
analyzed: idha tathāgataḥ anupādisesāya nibbāna dhātuyā parinibbutaḥ ti ānanda saddhassa kula puttassa dassanīyam savejanīyam ṭhāna
translated: ‘Here the Realised One was finally released in the Deathless’, Ānanda, is a place that inspires faith, for a faithful clansman.

original: Imāni kho, ānanda, cattāri saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyāni saṁvejanīyāni ṭhānāni.
analyzed: imāni kho ānanda cattāri saddhassa kula puttassa dassanīyāni savejanīyāni ṭhānāni
translated: These, Ānanda, are the four places that inspire faith, for a faithful clansman.

original: Āgamissanti kho, ānanda, saddhā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo upāsakā upāsikāyo:
analyzed: āgamissanti kho ānanda saddhāḥ bhikkhū bhikkhuniyaḥ upāsakāḥ upāsikāyaḥ
translated: Faithful monks, nuns, male and female lay followers will come, Ānanda, (thinking):

original: ‘idha tathāgato jāto’tipi, ‘idha tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’tipi,🔽‘idha tathāgatena anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitan’tipi, ‘idha tathāgato anupādisesāya
analyzed: idha tathāgataḥ jātaḥ itipi idha tathāgataḥ anuttaram sammāsambodhim abhisambuddhaḥ itipi 🔽idha tathāgatena anuttaram dhammacakkam idha tathāgataḥ an upādisesāya
translated: ‘Here the Realised One was born’, ‘Here the Realised One became fully awakened to the unsurpassed and Perfect Awakening’,🔽‘Here the Realised One set rolling the unsurpassed Dhamma Wheel’, ‘Here the Realised One was finally released in the Deathless’, Ānanda, is a place that inspires faith, for a faithful clansman.

original: nibbānadhātuyā parinibbuto’tipi.
analyzed: nibbāna dhātuyā parinibbuta utipi
translated: and he has attained final Nibbāna in the Nibbāna-element without residue remaining.’

original: Ye hi keci, ānanda, cetiyacārikaṁ āhiṇḍantā pasannacittā kālaṁ karissanti, sabbe te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjissantī”ti.
analyzed: ye hi keci ānanda cetiya cārikam āhiṇḍantā pasanna cittā kālam karissanti sabbe te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjissanti iti
translated: And those who, with confidence in their hearts, die while going to the shrine, on arriving at the shrine, or while circumambulating the shrine, all, with the breakup of the body, after death, will be reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.”

original: 29. Ānandapucchākathā
analyzed: ānanda pucchā kathā
translated: . The Discussion of Ānanda’s Question

original: “Kathaṁ mayaṁ, bhante, mātugāme paṭipajjāmā”ti?
analyzed: katham bhante mātugāme paṭipajjāma ati
translated: “Venerable sir, how should we conduct ourselves in regard to women?”

original: “Adassanaṁ, ānandā”ti.
analyzed: adassanaḥ ānanda ati
translated: “By not seeing them, Ānanda.”

original: “Dassane, bhagavā, sati kathaṁ paṭipajjitabban”ti?
analyzed: dassane bhagavā sati katham paṭipajjitabban ti
translated: “But if we see them, how should we conduct ourselves, venerable sir?”

original: “Anālāpo, ānandā”ti.
analyzed: an ālāpaḥ ānanda ati
translated: “By not conversing with them, Ānanda.”

original: “Ālapantena pana, bhante, kathaṁ paṭipajjitabban”ti?
analyzed: ālapantena pana bhante katham paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: “But if they converse with us, how should we conduct ourselves, venerable sir?”

original: “Sati, ānanda, upaṭṭhāpetabbā”ti.
analyzed: sati ānanda upaṭṭhāpetabbā ati
translated: “Mindfulness should be established, Ānanda.”

original: “Kathaṁ mayaṁ, bhante, tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjāmā”ti?
analyzed: katham bhante tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjāma ati
translated: “Venerable sir, how should we conduct ourselves in regard to the Tathāgata’s bodily remains?”

original: “Abyāvaṭā tumhe, ānanda, hotha tathāgatassa sarīrapūjāya.
analyzed: tumhe ānanda hotha tathāgatassa sarīra pūjāya
translated: “Do not worry, Ānanda, about the funeral observances for the Tathāgata.

original: Iṅgha tumhe, ānanda, sāratthe ghaṭatha anuyuñjatha, sāratthe appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharatha.
analyzed: iṅgha tumhe ānanda sāratthe ghaṭatha anuyuñjatha sāratthe appamattāḥ ātāpino pahitattāḥ viharatha
translated: Strive diligently, Ānanda, strive diligently to attain the unattained, to achieve the unachieved, to realize the unrealized.

original: Santānanda, khattiyapaṇḍitāpi brāhmaṇapaṇḍitāpi gahapatipaṇḍitāpi tathāgate abhippasannā, te tathāgatassa sarīrapūjaṁ karissantī”ti.
analyzed: santa ānanda khattiya paṇḍitā api brāhmaṇa paṇḍitā api gahapati paṇḍitā api tathāgate abhippasannā te tathāgatassa sarīra pūjam karissanti iti
translated: There are wise nobles, wise brahmins, and wise householders who have confidence in the Tathāgata. They will make offerings for the Tathāgata’s bodily relics.”

original: “Kathaṁ pana, bhante, tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabban”ti?
analyzed: katham pana bhante tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: “But, Sir, how should we proceed with the Tathāgata’s body?”

original: “Yathā kho, ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti, evaṁ tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabban”ti.
analyzed: yathā kho ānanda raññaḥ cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti evam tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: “Ānanda, you should proceed with the Tathāgata’s body in the same way they do with the body of a wheel-turning monarch.”

original: “Kathaṁ pana, bhante, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjantī”ti?🔽“Rañño, ānanda, cakkavattissa sarīraṁ ahatena vatthena veṭhenti, ahatena vatthena veṭhetvā vihatena kappāsena veṭhenti, vihatena kappāsena veṭhetvā ahatena vatthena veṭhenti.
analyzed: katham pana bhante raññaḥ cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti iti  raññaḥ ānanda cakkavattissa sarīram ahatena vatthena veṭhenti ahatena vatthena veṭhetvā vihatena kappāsena veṭhenti vihatena kappāsena veṭhetvā ahatena vatthena veṭhenti
translated: “But, Sir, how do they proceed with the body of a wheel-turning monarch?”🔽“Ānanda, they wrap the body of a wheel-turning monarch in new linen cloth. After they have done this five hundred times, they wrap it in beeswax.

original: Etenupāyena pañcahi yugasatehi rañño cakkavattissa sarīraṁ veṭhetvā āyasāya teladoṇiyā
analyzed: etena upāyena pañcahi yuga satehi raññaḥ cakkavattissa sarīram veṭhetvā āyasāya tela doṇiyā
translated: Then they make a funeral pyre of all kinds of fragrant substances,

original: pakkhipitvā aññissā āyasāya doṇiyā paṭikujjitvā sabbagandhānaṁ citakaṁ karitvā rañño🔽cakkavattissa sarīraṁ jhāpenti.
analyzed: pakkhipitvā aññissā āyasāya doṇiyā paṭikujjitvā sabba gandhānam citakam karitvā raññaḥ  cakkavattissa sarīram jhāpenti
translated: and then cremate the King’s body on a funeral pyre of all kinds of fragrances.

original: Cātumahāpathe rañño cakkavattissa thūpaṁ karonti.🔽Evaṁ kho, ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti.
analyzed: cātumahāpathe raññaḥ cakkavattissa thūpam karonti  evam kho ānanda raññaḥ cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti
translated: They build a memorial for the King at a crossroads.🔽This is how they deal with the body of a King who is a Wheel-turning Monarch.

original: Yathā kho, ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti, evaṁ tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: yathā kho ānanda raññaḥ cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti evam tathāgatassa sarīre
translated: And they should deal with the body of the Tathagata in the same way.

original: Cātumahāpathe tathāgatassa thūpo kātabbo.
analyzed: cātumahāpathe tathāgatassa thūpo kātabbo
translated: A memorial to the Tathagata should be built at a crossroads.

original: Tattha ye mālaṁ vā gandhaṁ vā cuṇṇakaṁ vā āropessanti vā abhivādessanti vā cittaṁ vā pasādessanti tesaṁ taṁ bhavissati dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya.
analyzed: tattha ye mālam vā gandham vā cuṇṇakam vā āropessanti vā abhivādessanti vā cittam vā pasādessanti tesam tam bhavissati dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya
translated: And those who offer a garland, a perfume, or a powder there, or pay homage with a devout mind, will be disposed to do good for a long time.

original: 30. Thūpārahapuggala
analyzed: thūpa araha puggala
translated: . The one worthy of a stupa

original: Cattārome, ānanda, thūpārahā.
analyzed: cattāro me ānanda thūpārahā
translated: “There are, Ananda, these four who are worthy of a stupa.

original: Katame cattāro?
analyzed: katame cattāro
translated: Which four?

original: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho, paccekasambuddho thūpāraho, tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho, rājā cakkavattī thūpārahoti.
analyzed: tathāgataḥ araham sammāsambuddhaḥ thūpāraho paccekasambuddhaḥ thūpāraho tathāgatassa sāvakaḥ thūpārahaḥ rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho ti
translated: The Realised One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha is worthy of a monument, the Independent Sambuddha is worthy of a monument, the Realised One’s disciple is worthy of a monument, the King who rules according to the Dhamma is worthy of a monument.

original: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho?
analyzed: kiñca ānanda atthavasam paṭicca tathāgataḥ araham sammāsambuddhaḥ thūpāraho
translated: And why, Ānanda, is the Realised One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha worthy of a monument?

original: ‘Ayaṁ tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
analyzed: ayam tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa thūpaḥ ti ānanda bahu janāḥ cittam pasādenti
translated: ‘This is the monument of that Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha,’ Ānanda, many people purify their mind.

original: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
analyzed: te tattha cittam pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti
translated: Having purified their mind, after the break-up of the body, after death, they arise in a happy destiny, in a heavenly world.

original: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho.
analyzed: idam kho ānanda atthavasam paṭicca tathāgataḥ araham sammāsambuddhaḥ thūpāraho
translated: This is the reason, Ānanda, why the Realised One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha is worthy of a monument.

original: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca paccekasambuddho thūpāraho?
analyzed: kiñca ānanda atthavasam paṭicca paccekasambuddhaḥ thūpāraho
translated: And why, Ānanda, is the Independent Sambuddha worthy of a monument?

original: ‘Ayaṁ tassa bhagavato paccekasambuddhassa thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
analyzed: ayam tassa bhagavataḥ paccekasambuddhassa thūpaḥ ti ānanda bahu janāḥ cittam pasādenti
translated: ‘This is the monument of that Fortunate One, the Independent Sambuddha,’ Ānanda, many people purify their mind.

original: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
analyzed: te tattha cittam pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti
translated: Having purified their mind, after the break-up of the body, after death, they arise in a happy destiny, in a heavenly world.

original: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca paccekasambuddho thūpāraho.
analyzed: idam kho ānanda atthavasam paṭicca paccekasambuddhaḥ thūpāraho
translated: This is why a Paccekabuddha is worthy of a monument.

original: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho?
analyzed: kiñca ānanda atthavasam paṭicca tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho
translated: “And why, Ananda, is a disciple of the Tathagata worthy of a monument?

original: ‘Ayaṁ tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa sāvakassa thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
analyzed: ayam tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa sāvakassa thūpaḥ ti ānanda bahu janāḥ cittam pasādenti
translated: Because, Ananda, many people will have confidence in a monument to the disciple of the Tathagata, thinking: ‘This is the monument to the disciple of the Tathagata.’

original: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
analyzed: te tattha cittam pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti
translated: And having gained confidence, they will attain a state of great good fortune in the world of the gods or in the human world.

original: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho.
analyzed: idam kho ānanda atthavasam paṭicca tathāgatassa sāvakaḥ thūpāraho
translated: This is why a disciple of the Tathagata is worthy of a monument.

original: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho?
analyzed: kiñca ānanda atthavasam paṭicca rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho
translated: “And why, Ananda, is a Wheel-turning Monarch worthy of a monument?

original: ‘Ayaṁ tassa dhammikassa dhammarañño thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
analyzed: ayam tassa dhammikassa dhamma raññaḥ thūpaḥ ti ānanda bahu janā cittam pasādenti
translated: Because, Ananda, many people will have confidence in a monument to the Wheel-turning Monarch, thinking: ‘This is the monument to the Wheel-turning Monarch.’

original: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
analyzed: te tattha cittam pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti
translated: And having gained confidence, they will attain a state of great good fortune in the world of the gods or in the human world.

original: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho.
analyzed: idam kho ānanda atthavasam paṭicca rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho
translated: This is why a Wheel-turning Monarch is worthy of a monument.”

original: Ime kho, ānanda, cattāro thūpārahā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho ānanda cattāro
translated: These are the four kinds of monuments worthy of a stupa.”

original: 31. Ānandaacchariyadhamma
analyzed: ānanda acchariya dhamma
translated: . The amazing qualities of Ānanda

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando vihāraṁ pavisitvā kapisīsaṁ ālambitvā rodamāno aṭṭhāsi:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ vihāram pavisitvā kapi sīsam ālambitvā rodamānaḥ aṭṭhāsi
translated: Then Ānanda entered his dwelling and stood lamenting by the door frame:

original: “ahañca vatamhi sekho sakaraṇīyo, satthu ca me parinibbānaṁ bhavissati, yo mama anukampako”ti.
analyzed: aham ca vatamhi sekhaḥ sa karaṇīyaḥ satthu ca me parinibbānam bhavissati yaḥ mama anukampako ti
translated: “I’m still a learner with much to do. And now the Teacher is passing away, he who has compassion for me.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: The Buddha said to the monks,

original: “kahaṁ nu kho, bhikkhave, ānando”ti?
analyzed: kaham nu kho bhikkhave ānandaḥ ti
translated: “Where’s Ānanda?”

original: “Eso, bhante, āyasmā ānando vihāraṁ pavisitvā kapisīsaṁ ālambitvā rodamāno ṭhito:
analyzed: esaḥ bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ vihāram pavisitvā kapi sīsam ālambitvā rodamānaḥ ṭhitaḥ
translated: “Venerable Ānanda has entered his dwelling and is standing lamenting by the door frame:

original: ‘ahañca vatamhi sekho sakaraṇīyo, satthu ca me parinibbānaṁ bhavissati, yo mama anukampako’”ti.
analyzed: aham ca vatamhi sekhaḥ sa karaṇīyaḥ satthu ca me parinibbānam bhavissati yaḥ mama anukampako ti
translated: ‘I’m still a learner with much to do. And now the Teacher is passing away, he who has compassion for me.’”

original: Atha kho bhagavā aññataraṁ bhikkhuṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā aññataram bhikkhum āmantesi
translated: The Buddha said to a certain monk,

original: “ehi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena ānandaṁ āmantehi:
analyzed: ehi tva bhikkhu mama vacanena ānandam āmantehi
translated: “Go to Ānanda and say to him,

original: ‘satthā taṁ, āvuso ānanda, āmantetī’”ti.
analyzed: satthā te āvuso ānandaḥ āmanteti iti
translated: ‘Friend Ānanda, the Teacher calls you.’”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho so bhikkhu bhagavato paṭissutvā yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:🔽“satthā taṁ, āvuso ānanda, āmantetī”ti.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho saḥ bhikkhu bhagavataḥ paṭissutvā yena āyasmā ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca  satthā te āvuso ānandaḥ āmanteti iti
translated: “Yes, friend,” he replied, and he went to Ven. Ānanda and on arrival said to him, “The Teacher calls you, friend Ānanda.”

original: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā ānando tassa bhikkhuno paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami;🔽upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho āyasmantaṁ
analyzed: evam āvuso ti kho āyasman ānandaḥ tassa bhikkhuno paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami  upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnam kho āyasmanta
translated: “As you say, friend,” Ven. Ānanda replied. He went to the Blessed One and, on arrival, having bowed down to him, sat to one side.

original: ānandaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:🔽“alaṁ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi, nanu etaṁ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacceva akkhātaṁ:
analyzed: ānandam bhagavān etat avoca  ala ānanda mā soci mā paridevi nanu eta ānanda mayā paṭikaccā iva akkhāta
translated: As he was sitting there, the Blessed One said to him,

original: ‘sabbeheva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo’;
analyzed: sabbehi iva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvaḥ vinābhāvaḥ aññathābhāvaḥ
translated: “Enough, Ānanda. Don’t grieve, don’t lament. Haven’t I already taught you the state of growing different with regard to all things dear & appealing, the state of becoming separate, the state of becoming otherwise?🔽So how could this be possible: that what is born, come into being, fabricated, & subject to disintegration should not disintegrate?

original: taṁ kutettha, ānanda, labbhā. Yaṁ taṁ jātaṁ bhūtaṁ saṅkhataṁ palokadhammaṁ, ‘taṁ vata tathāgatassāpi sarīraṁ mā palujjī’ti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
analyzed: tam kuta itthā ānanda labbhā yam tam jātam bhūtam saṅkhatam paloka dhamma tam vata tathāgatassa api sarīram mā palujji iti na itam ṭhānam vijjati
translated: That will not be .

original: Dīgharattaṁ kho te, ānanda, tathāgato paccupaṭṭhito mettena kāyakammena hitena sukhena🔽advayena appamāṇena, mettena vacīkammena hitena sukhena advayena appamāṇena, mettena
analyzed: dīgharattam kho te ānanda tathāgataḥ paccupaṭṭhitaḥ mettena kāya kammena hitena sukhena  advayena appamāṇena mettena vacī kammena hitena sukhena advayena appamāṇena mettena
translated: For a long time, Ānanda, the Tathāgata has been devoted to friendliness,🔽to welfare, to happiness,🔽to friendliness, to welfare, to happiness,

original: manokammena hitena sukhena advayena appamāṇena.
analyzed: manaḥ kammena hitena sukhena advayena appamāṇena
translated: to friendliness, to welfare, to happiness,

original: Katapuññosi tvaṁ, ānanda, padhānamanuyuñja, khippaṁ hohisi anāsavo”ti.
analyzed: kata puññaḥ asi tvaṃ ānanda padhānam anuyuñja khippam hohisi anāsavaḥ ti
translated: You have done good deeds, Ānanda, apply your mind to the Deathless, soon you will be free of defilements.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Then the Fortunate One addressed the monks, saying:

original: “yepi te, bhikkhave, ahesuṁ atītamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, tesampi bhagavantānaṁ etapparamāyeva upaṭṭhākā ahesuṁ, seyyathāpi mayhaṁ ānando.
analyzed: ye pi te bhikkhave ahesum atītam addhānam arahanto sammāsambuddhā tesam pi bhagavantānam etad paramāya iva upaṭṭhākā ahesu seyyathā api mayham ānandaḥ
translated: “For those monks who are Worthy and Perfect Sambuddhas in the past, monks, they also had attendants who were just as much the utmost, just like Ānanda to me.

original: Yepi te, bhikkhave, bhavissanti anāgatamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, tesampi bhagavantānaṁ etapparamāyeva upaṭṭhākā bhavissanti, seyyathāpi mayhaṁ ānando.🔽Paṇḍito, bhikkhave, ānando;
analyzed: ye pi te bhikkhave bhavissanti anāgatam addhānam arahanto sammāsambuddhā tesam pi bhagavantānam etad paramāya iva upaṭṭhākāḥ bhavissanti seyyathā api mayham ānandaḥ  paṇḍitaḥ bhikkhave ānandaḥ
translated: For those monks who are Worthy and Perfect Sambuddhas in the future, monks, they also will have attendants who will be just as much the utmost, just like Ānanda to me.🔽Ānanda is wise, monks,

original: medhāvī, bhikkhave, ānando.
analyzed: medhāvī bhikkhave ānandaḥ
translated: Ānanda is clever,

original: Jānāti ‘ayaṁ kālo tathāgataṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ayaṁ kālo bhikkhunīnaṁ,
analyzed: jānāti ayam kālaḥ tathāgatam dassanāya upasaṅkamitum bhikkhūna ayam kālaḥ bhikkhunīna
translated: He knows when it is the right time to visit the monks, the nuns,

original: ayaṁ kālo upāsakānaṁ, ayaṁ kālo upāsikānaṁ, ayaṁ kālo rañño rājamahāmattānaṁ titthiyānaṁ🔽titthiyasāvakānan’ti.
analyzed: ayam kālaḥ upāsakāna ayam kālaḥ upāsikāna ayam kālaḥ raññaḥ rāja mahāmattānam titthiyāna  titthiya sāvakānanti
translated: the male lay followers, the female lay followers, the kings and their ministers, and various other religious teachers and their disciples.

original: Cattārome, bhikkhave, acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande.
analyzed: cattāro me bhikkhave acchariyāḥ abbhutāḥ dhammāḥ ānande
translated: “There are, bhikkhus, these four astounding and amazing qualities in Ananda.

original: Katame cattāro?🔽Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
analyzed: katame cattāro  sace bhikkhave bhikkhu parisā ānandam dassanāya upasaṅkamati dassanena sā attamanā hoti
translated: What four?🔽If a bhikkhu assembly approaches Ananda to see him, they are satisfied by merely seeing him.

original: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
analyzed: tatra ce ānandaḥ dhammam bhāsati bhāsitena api sā atta manāḥ hoti
translated: If he speaks the Dhamma to them, they are satisfied by his speech.

original: Atittāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā hoti, atha kho ānando tuṇhī hoti.🔽Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
analyzed: atittāva bhikkhave bhikkhu parisā hoti atha kho ānandaḥ tuṇhī hoti  sace bhikkhave bhikkhunī parisā ānandam dassanāya upasaṅkamati dassanena sā attamanā hoti
